translated: I bow to the ocean of Vaikhānasa, pure with the water of devotion to Viṣṇu.

original: yenānyakḷptasūtrāṇāṃ netraṃ nistimirīkṛtam /
analyzed: yena anya kḷpta sūtrāṇām netram nistimirīkṛtam
translated: By which the eyes of those whose threads are arranged by others have been made free from darkness,

original: sūtraṃ vaikhānasaṃ hy etat caturvargaphalapradam //🔽śrutismṛtītihāsādyaiḥ pratipāditavaibhavām /
analyzed: sūtram vaikhānasam hi etat caturvarga phala pradam  śruti smṛti itihāsa ādyaiḥ pratipādita vaibhavām
translated: This thread is indeed the Vaikhānasa thread, which gives the fruits of the four goals of human life.

original: paramātmaparāṃ vande sūtropaniṣadaṃ parām //
translated: I bow to the supreme Upaniṣad of the Sūtras, which is dedicated to the supreme Self and whose glory is proclaimed by the Śrutis, Smṛtis, Itihāsas and other scriptures.

original: vyākhyānakartṛgotranāmādi
analyzed: vyākhyāna kartṛ gotra nāma ādi
translated: The name of the author of the commentary

original: śrīmatkauśikavaṃśyena govindācāryasūnunā /
analyzed: śrīmat kauśika vaṃśyena govinda ācārya sūnunā
translated: By the illustrious son of Govindācārya, born in the Kaushika dynasty,

original: śrīveṅkaṭeśapādābjasaparyāsu ratātmanā //
translated: Who is devoted to the service of the lotus feet of Śrī Veṅkaṭeśa,

original: śrutismṛtipurāṇādisiddhamārgānuvartinā /
analyzed: śruti smṛti purāṇa ādi siddha mārga anuvartinā
translated: Who follows the path established by the Śrutis, Smṛtis, Purāṇas and other scriptures,

original: pūrvācāryaparikṣuṇṇasampradāyānuyāyinā //
analyzed: pūrva ācārya parikṣuṇṇa sampradāya anuyāyinā
translated: Who follows the tradition that has been cultivated by the teachers of the past,

original: vedāntācāryavaryeṇa śrīnivāsāryayajvanā /
translated: By the excellent Vedānta teacher, the noble Śrīnivāsa Āryayajvan,

original: vaikhānasasya sūtrasya vyākhyā samyak prakāśyate //
analyzed: vaikhānasasya sūtrasya vyākhyā samyak prakāśyate
translated: The commentary on the Sūtra of the Vaikhānasa is being fully revealed.

original: vikhānasasūtrasya tadanuyāyināṃ ca sarvotkṛṣṭatve daśavidhahetūnāṃ nirdeśaḥ
analyzed: vikhānasa sūtrasya tad anuyāyinām ca sarva utkṛṣṭa tve daśavidha hetūnām nirdeśaḥ
translated: The ten reasons for the superiority of the Vaikhānasa Sūtra and its followers

original: atha satyatvādisamastakalyāṇaguṇaviśiṣṭāt parabrahmaṇaḥ śrīmannārāyaṇād utpannena
analyzed: atha satya tva ādi samasta kalyāṇa guṇa viśiṣṭāt para brahmaṇaḥ śrīmat nārāyaṇāt utpannena
translated: Now, from the Supreme Brahman, the glorious Nārāyaṇa, who is endowed with all excellent qualities such as truthfulness,

original: vikhanaśśabdavācyena caturmukhabrahmaṇā praṇītasya vaikhānasasūtrasya sarvasūtrottamatve
analyzed: vikhanaḥ śabda vācyena caturmukha brahmaṇā praṇītasya vaikhānasa sūtrasya sarva sūtra uttama tve
translated: the Vaikhānasa Sūtra, composed by the four-faced Brahmā, who is denoted by the word Vaikhānasa,

original: tatsūtroktadharmānuṣṭhātṝṇāṃ sarvotkṛṣṭatamatve ca daśavidhahetavo nirūpyante /
analyzed: tad sūtra ukta dharma anuṣṭhātṝṇām sarva utkṛṣṭatama tve ca daśavidha hetavaḥ nirūpyante
translated: and the ten reasons for the superiority of those who practice the duties taught in that Sūtra are described.

original: yathā /🔽akhilajagatkāraṇabhūtena vikhanasā praṇītatvāt / sarvasūtrāṇām āditvāt / sarvakarmasu
analyzed: yathā  akhila jagat kāraṇa bhūtena vikhanasā praṇīta tvāt sarva sūtrāṇām ādi tvāt sarva karmasu
translated: As follows.🔽Because it was composed by the Vaikhānasa, who is the cause of the entire world, because it is the first of all the Sūtras, because it is the path of the Vedas

original: śrutimārgānusāritvāt / samantrakasarvakriyāpratipādakatvāt / niṣekasaṃskārādimatvāt /
analyzed: śruti mārga anusāri tvāt sa mantraka sarva kriyā pratipādaka tvāt niṣeka saṃskāra ādima tvāt
translated: in all actions, because it teaches all actions along with the mantras, because it contains the consecrations beginning with the sprinkling,

original: aṣṭādaśaśārīrasaṃskārapratipādakatvāt / sāṅgakriyākalāpavattvāt / manvādyaiḥ svīkṛtatvāt /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa śārīra saṃskāra pratipādaka tvāt sa aṅga kriyā kalāpavat tvāt manu ādyaiḥ svīkṛta tvāt
translated: because it teaches the eighteen bodily consecrations, because it possesses the collection of ancillary actions, because it was accepted by Manu and others,

original: akhilajagadekakāraṇabhūtaśrīmannārāyaṇaikaparatvāt / etatsūtroktadharmānuṣṭhānavatām
analyzed: akhila jagat eka kāraṇa bhūta śrīmat nārāyaṇa eka para tvāt etad sūtra ukta dharma anuṣṭhānavatām
translated: because it is solely devoted to the glorious Nārāyaṇa, who is the sole cause of the entire world, and because those who practice the duties taught in this Sūtra

original: eva bhagavatpriyatamatvopapatteś ca / iti /
analyzed: eva bhagavat priyatama tva upapatteḥ ca iti
translated: And because of this, he is rightly considered the most beloved of the Blessed Lord.

original: ebhir hetubhir asya sūtrasya sarvasūtrottamatvaṃ etatsūtroktadharmānuṣṭhānād
analyzed: ebhiḥ hetubhiḥ asya sūtrasya sarva sūtra uttama tvam etad sūtra ukta dharma anuṣṭhānāt
translated: By these reasons, the supremacy of this sūtra over all other sūtras is established, and by the practice of the teachings expounded in this sūtra,

original: eva vaikhānasānāṃ sarvebhyaḥ śreṣṭhatamatvāñ ca śrutismṛtipurāṇādimukhena pratipādyate /
analyzed: eva vaikhānasānām sarvebhyaḥ śreṣṭhatama tvām ca śruti smṛti purāṇa ādi mukhena pratipādyate
translated: the Vaikhānasa ascetics are shown to be the most excellent of all, through the scriptures, Smṛtis, Purāṇas, etc.

original: tatrādau akhilajagatkāraṇabhūtena vikhanasā praṇītatvād iti hetur nirūpyate /
analyzed: tatra ādau akhila jagat kāraṇa bhūtena vikhanasā praṇīta tvāt iti hetuḥ nirūpyate
translated: There, at the beginning, the reason is stated that it was composed by Viṣṇu, who is the cause of the entire world.

original: vikhanaśśabdārthanirṇayaḥ
analyzed: vikhanaḥ śabda artha nirṇayaḥ
translated: Determination of the meaning of the word Viṣṇu

original: nārāyaṇasya vikhano vaikhānasādiśabdavācyatvam
analyzed: nārāyaṇasya vikhanaḥ vaikhānasa ādi śabda vācya tvam
translated: Nārāyaṇa is denoted by the words Viṣṇu, Vaikhānasa, etc.

original: vikhanā nāma kaścid ṛṣiḥ /
analyzed: vikhanāḥ nāma kaścid ṛṣiḥ
translated: There is a certain sage named Viṣṇu.

original: uta nārāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: uta nārāyaṇaḥ
translated: Or is it Nārāyaṇa?

original: nārāyaṇa eva kevalaṃ /🔽munimātrasya vaikhānasaśabdavācyatvena pratipādanābhāvāt / paramātmano nārāyaṇasya vikhano vaikhānasādiśabdavācyatvaṃ śrutismṛtipurāṇādiṣv
analyzed: nārāyaṇaḥ eva kevalam  muni mātrasya vaikhānasa śabda vācya tvena pratipādana abhāvāt paramātmanaḥ nārāyaṇasya vikhanaḥ vaikhānasa ādi śabda vācya tvam śruti smṛti purāṇa ādiṣu
translated: Only Nārāyaṇa himself.

original: avagamyate / yathā /
analyzed: avagamyate yathā
translated: Because there is no teaching that the mere sage is denoted by the word Vaikhānasa, the fact that the supreme self Nārāyaṇa is denoted by the words Viṣṇu, Vaikhānasa, etc. is understood from the Śrutis, Smṛtis, Purāṇas, etc. For example,

original: khilaśrutau /
analyzed: khila śrutau
translated: in the Khilā Śruti:

original: dhenur vahāṇām aditis surāṇāṃ brahmā ṛbhūṇāṃ vikhanā munīnām /
analyzed: dhenuḥ vahāṇām aditiḥ surāṇām brahmā ṛbhūṇām vikhanāḥ munīnām
translated: The cow is the best of vehicles, Aditi of the gods, Brahmā of the Ṛbhus, Viṣṇu of the sages.

original: iti śruyate / ayam arthaḥ / vahānāṃ ataḍudādīnāṃ dhenuḥ utpattikāraṇam / surāṇāṃ indrādīnām aditiḥ / ṛbhūṇāṃ /
analyzed: iti śruyate ayam arthaḥ vahānām ataḍuh ādīnām dhenuḥ utpatti kāraṇam surāṇām indra ādīnām aditiḥ ṛbhūṇām
translated: This is heard. The meaning is this. The cow is the cause of origin of the vehicles like the chariot, etc. Aditi is of the gods like Indra, etc. Of the Rbhus,

original: sādhyā viśve ca vasavo maruto ṛbhavas tathā /
analyzed: sādhyāḥ viśve ca vasavaḥ marutaḥ ṛbhavaḥ tathā
translated: The Sadhyas, the Vishvas, the Vasus, the Maruts, and the Rbhus,

original: tathaivāṅgiraso rudrā ādityāś ca tathaiva ca /
analyzed: tathā eva aṅgirasaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ ca tathā eva ca
translated: And likewise the Angirasas, the Rudras, and the Adityas as well,

original: ete devagaṇāś cāṣṭau manvantaragaṇeśvarāḥ //
analyzed: ete deva gaṇāḥ ca aṣṭau manvantara gaṇa īśvarāḥ
translated: These are the eight groups of gods, the lords of the groups in the Manu periods.

original: iti bhṛgūktānāṃ sādhyādīnāṃ brahmā / munīnāṃ muniśabdavācyānāṃ vikhanāḥ /
analyzed: iti bhṛgu uktānām sādhya ādīnām brahmā munīnām muni śabda vācyānām vikhanāḥ
translated: Thus, of the Sadhyas and others mentioned by Bhrigu, Brahma is the father. Of the sages called by the word muni, the creator is the father.

original: brahmaṇo muniśabdavācyatvaṃ bhārate cāvagamyate
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ muni śabda vācya tvam bhārate ca avagamyate
translated: The fact that Brahma is called by the word muni is understood in the Mahabharata

original: niśāṃ suptvātha bhagavān kṣapānte pratyabuddhyata / MBh / App / /
analyzed: niśām suptvā atha bhagavān kṣapā ante pratyabuddhyata
translated: The Lord, having slept during the night, awoke at the end of the night.

original: paścād buddhvā sasarjāpaḥ tāsu vīryam avāsṛjat // MBh / App / /
analyzed: paścāt buddhvā sasarja apaḥ tāsu vīryam avāsṛjat
translated: Having understood later, he emitted his semen into the waters.

original: tad aṇḍam abhavad dhaimaṃ sahasrāṃśusamaprabham / MBh / App / /
analyzed: tat aṇḍam abhavat dhaimam sahasrāṃśu sama prabham
translated: That became a golden egg, having the luster of a thousand suns.

original: ahaṅkṛtyā tatas tasmin sasarja prabhur īśvaraḥ / MBh / App / /
analyzed: ahaṅkṛtyā tatas tasmin sasarja prabhuḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: In that, the Lord, the Supreme Being, created the ego.

original: hiraṇyagarbhaṃ viśvātmā brahmāṇaṃ jalajaṃ munim // iti MBh / App / /
analyzed: hiraṇyagarbham viśvātmā brahmāṇam jala jam munim iti
translated: The universal soul created Hiranyagarbha, the lotus-born sage Brahma.

original: aṇḍabahutvābhiprāyeṇa munīnām iti bahuvacanam / yathā🔽aṇḍānān tu sahasrāṇāṃ sahasrāṇy ayutāni ca /
analyzed: aṇḍa bahutva abhiprāyeṇa munīnām iti bahuvacanam yathā  aṇḍānām tu sahasrāṇām sahasrāṇi ayutāni ca
translated: The plural sages is used with the intention of referring to many eggs. As it is said:🔽But from the eggs, there are thousands of thousands and myriads,

original: īdṛśānām anantānāṃ koṭikoṭiśatāni ce//
analyzed: īdṛśānām anantānām koṭi koṭi śatāni ce
translated: Of such endless ones, with hundreds of thousands of millions.

original: ti smaraṇāt /
analyzed: ti smaraṇāt
translated: Because of the recollection.

original: niśā cātra pralayaḥ /
analyzed: niśā ca atra pralayaḥ
translated: And here, night means dissolution.

original: sā etāvatīti kutrāvagamyata iti cet /
analyzed: sā etāvatī iti kutra avagamyate iti ced
translated: If it is asked where it is understood that it is of this extent,

original: mahābhārate /
analyzed: mahābhārate
translated: In the Mahabharata.🔽Brahmins who see the truth say that a thousand sets of four yugas and a hundred sets of four yugas,

original: caturyugasahasrāṇi caturyugaśatāni ca / MBh / App / /🔽prāhuḥ kalpasahasran tu brāhmaṇās tattvadarśinaḥ / MBh / App / /
analyzed: caturyuga sahasrāṇi caturyuga śatāni ca  prāhuḥ kalpa sahasran tu brāhmaṇāḥ tattva darśinaḥ
translated: Are one thousand sets of four yugas and a hundred sets of four yugas.

original: daśakalpasahasrāṇi apy ayas sā mahāniśā // iti / MBh / App / /
analyzed: daśa kalpa sahasrāṇi api ayaḥ sā mahāniśā iti
translated: And that great night is for ten thousand sets of four yugas.

original: anayā khilaśrutyā bhagavato vikhanaśśabdavācyatvaṃ katham avagamyata iti cet ucyate /
analyzed: anayā khila śrutyā bhagavataḥ vikhanaḥ śabda vācya tvam katham avagamyate iti ced ucyate
translated: If it is asked how it is understood from this supplementary text that the Blessed One is denoted by the word vikhana, it is said:

original: itihāsapurāṇābhyām eva vedārthasya nirṇeyatvam
analyzed: itihāsa purāṇābhyām eva veda arthasya nirṇeya tvam
translated: The meaning of the Vedas is to be ascertained only through Itihasa and Purana.

original: durbodhā vaidikāś śabdā prakīrṇatvāc ca ye khilāḥ /
analyzed: durbodhāḥ vaidikāḥ śabdāḥ prakīrṇa tvāt ca ye khilāḥ
translated: The Vedic words are difficult to understand and the supplementary texts are scattered.

original: tadjñais ta eva spaṣṭārthāḥ smṛtitantre pratiṣṭhitāḥ // iti
analyzed: tad jñaiḥ te eva spaṣṭa arthāḥ smṛti tantre pratiṣṭhitāḥ iti
translated: Those who know them have established them in the Smriti Tantra with clear meanings.

original: yadi vidyāc caturvedān sāṅgopaniṣadān dvijaḥ /
analyzed: yadi vidyāt catur vedān sāṅga upaniṣadān dvijaḥ
translated: If a twice-born knows the four Vedas with their limbs and Upanishads,

original: na cet purāṇasadvidyā na vedārthavicakṣaṇaḥ // iti
analyzed: na ced purāṇa sat vidyāḥ na veda artha vicakṣaṇaḥ iti
translated: If he is not well-versed in the ancient scriptures or skilled in understanding the meaning of the Vedas.

original: itihāsapurāṇābhyāṃ vedaṃ samupabṛhmayet /
analyzed: itihāsa purāṇābhyām vedam
translated: One should supplement the Vedas with Itihasa and Purana.

original: bibhety alpaśruvād vedo mām ayaṃ pratariṣyati // iti ca MBh / /
analyzed: bibheti alpa śruvāt vedaḥ mām ayam pratariṣyati iti ca mbh
translated: The Vedas fear one with little learning, thinking He will cross me over.

original: smaraṇāt itihāsapurāṇābhyām evārthanirṇayaḥ kartavyaḥ / bhārate mokṣadharme nāradastutau /
analyzed: smaraṇāt itihāsa purāṇābhyām eva artha nirṇayaḥ kartavyaḥ bhārate mokṣa dharme nārada stutau
translated: The determination of meaning should be done only through Itihasa and Purana. In the Mokshadharma of the Mahabharata, in the praise of Narada.

original: namas te devadeveśa ity ārabhya stotramadhye phenapācārya vālakhilya vikhano vikhanasa vaikhānasācārya abhagnayoga abhagnaparisaṅkhyāna
analyzed: namaḥ te devadeveśe iti ārabhya stotra madhye phenapa ācārya vālakhilya vikhano vikhanasa vaikhānasa ācārya abhagna yoga abhagna parisaṅkhyāna
translated: Salutations to you, O Lord of the gods of gods, beginning from here, in the middle of the hymn, the teacher of the foam-drinkers, the Valakhilyas, the digger, the digger of the Vaikhanasas, the unbroken yoga, the unbroken enumeration

original: tatraiva / yat tasminn upalabhyaṃ te tat tejas tat trayīmayam /
analyzed: tatra eva yat tasmin upalabhyam te tat tejaḥ tat trayī mayam
translated: There itself. Whatever is perceived in that, that is your radiance, that is made of the three Vedas,

original: tad vaikhānaḥ paraṃ brahma iti vedavido viduḥ //
analyzed: tat vaikhānaḥ param brahma iti veda vidaḥ viduḥ
translated: That is the supreme Brahman of the Vaikhanasas, know the knowers of the Vedas.

original: iti coktam / MBh
analyzed: iti ca uktam mbh
translated: Thus it is said. Mahabharata

original: vikhanaśśabdanirvacanam
analyzed: vikhanaḥ śabda nirvacanam
translated: The derivation of the word vikhana

original: tathā nāmasahasrādhyāye vaikhānas sāmagāyanaḥ iti smaryate /
analyzed: tathā nāmasahasrādhyāye vaikhānas sāmagāyanaḥ iti smaryate
translated: Similarly, in the chapter on the thousand names, the Vaikhanasa is remembered as the chanter of the Sama Veda.

original: jagatsṛṣṭiprayojanam
analyzed: jagat sṛṣṭi prayojanam
translated: The purpose of the creation of the world

original: pañcarātre ātmasaṃhitāyām /
analyzed: pañcarātre ātmasaṃhitāyām
translated: In the Pancharatra, in the Atmasamhita.

original: mahābhūtena bhūtena vyāptaṃ vikhanasā jagat /
analyzed: mahābhūtena bhūtena vyāptam vikhanasā jagat
translated: The world is pervaded by the great element and the element of the digger.

original: tam eva śaraṇaṃ gaccha jagatkāraṇam acyutam //
analyzed: tam eva śaraṇam gaccha jagat kāraṇam acyutam
translated: Go to Him alone for refuge, the unfallen cause of the universe.

original: Ātmasaṃhitā
analyzed: ātma saṃhitā
translated: The Ātma-saṃhitā

original: iti śāṇḍilyena śatānandam abhilakṣyoktam /
analyzed: iti śāṇḍilyena śatānandam abhilakṣya uktam
translated: Thus it was said by Śāṇḍilya, aiming at Śatānanda.

original: vaikhānase ānandasaṃhitāyāṃ /
analyzed: vaikhānase ānandasaṃhitāyām
translated: In the Ānanda-saṃhitā of the Vaikhānasa.

original: vedāntatattvamīmāṃsākhananaṃ kṛtavāt hariḥ /
translated: Hari, having dug up the essence of Vedānta philosophy,

original: nāmnā vikhanasaṃ prāhur yañ ca vaikhānasaṃ tathā //
analyzed: nāmnā vikhanasam prāhuḥ yam ca vaikhānasam tathā
translated: is called by the name Vaikhānasa, and also Vaikhānasa.

original: iti proktam / ĀS
analyzed: iti proktam ās
translated: Thus it is said. Here

original: atra khananaśabdena saṅkalpa ucyate / so 'kāmayata / bahu syāṃ prajāyeyeti
analyzed: atra khanana śabdena saṅkalpaḥ ucyate saḥ kāmayata bahu syām prajāyeya iti
translated: the word dug refers to resolve. He desired: Let me become many, let me be born.

original: sa tapo 'tayata ityādi śrutibhyaḥ / avāptasamastakāmasyāpi bhagavataḥ sṛṣṭikārye pravṛttir bhavati /
analyzed: sa ityādi śrutibhyaḥ avāpta samasta kāmasya api bhagavataḥ sṛṣṭi kārye pravṛttiḥ bhavati
translated: From the scriptures beginning with He performed austerity, the Lord, who has attained all desires, engages in the activity of creation.

original: samaṣṭisṛṣṭilakṣaṇam
analyzed: samaṣṭi sṛṣṭi lakṣaṇam
translated: The characteristic of universal creation

original: nanu satyavādisamastakalyāṇaguṇaviśiṣṭasya bhagavataḥ /
analyzed: nanu satya vādi samasta kalyāṇa guṇa viśiṣṭasya bhagavataḥ
translated: Now, if it is said that the Lord, who is truthful, endowed with all auspicious qualities,

original: aiśvaryasya samagrasya vīryasya yaśasaḥ śriyaḥ /
analyzed: aiśvaryasya samagrasya vīryasya yaśasaḥ śriyaḥ
translated: Of sovereignty, of all, of valor, of fame, of prosperity,

original: jñānavairāgyayoś caiva ṣaṇṇāṃ bhaga itīraṇā //
analyzed: jñāna vairāgyayoḥ ca eva ṣaṇṇām bhagaḥ iti īraṇā
translated: of knowledge and detachment, of the six, He is the Blessed One.

original: iti samagraṣāḍguṇyaparipūrṇasya avāptasamastakāmasya kimarthaṃ sṛṣṭyadikam iti cet ucyate /
analyzed: iti samagra ṣāḍguṇya paripūrṇasya avāpta samasta kāmasya kimartham sṛṣṭi ādikam iti ced ucyate
translated: Thus, if it is asked why the creation, etc. are for the Lord who is fully endowed with the six qualities and has attained all desires, it is said:

original: aprameyo 'niyojyaś ca yatra kāmagamo vaśī / MBh / App / /
analyzed: aprameyaḥ niyojyaḥ ca yatra kāma gamaḥ vaśī
translated: He is immeasurable, not to be employed, having mastery over going wherever he wishes,

original: modate bhagavān bhūtaiḥ bālaḥ kīḍanakair iva // MBh / App / /
analyzed: modate bhagavān bhūtaiḥ bālaḥ kīḍanakaiḥ iva
translated: the Lord delights with the beings, like a child with playthings.

original: ityādi bhāratavacanānusāreṇa līlārtham eveti /
analyzed: ityādi bhārata vacana anusāreṇa līlā artham eva iti
translated: Thus, in accordance with the statements of the Mahabharata, it is only for the sake of play.

original: jagadsṛṣṭyādilīlānubhavārthaṃ bhagavatā samaṣṭisṛṣṭer anantaraṃ vyaṣṭisṛṣṭau
translated: For the experience of the play of creating the world etc., after the creation of the totality, the Lord created Brahma for the creation of the particulars🔽in the form of various beings like gods, humans etc. This creation consisting of the manifest and unmanifest is done by the Lord.

original: devamanuṣyādivividhaviśeṣasṛṣṭyarthaṃ caturmukhasṛṣṭiṃ prati dhyānaṃ kṛtam / eṣā cidacidātmikā sṛṣṭiḥ bhagavatā kriyate / vyaṣṭisṛṣṭis
analyzed: deva manuṣya ādi vividha viśeṣa sṛṣṭi artham caturmukha sṛṣṭim prati dhyānam kṛtam eṣā cit acit ātmikā sṛṣṭiḥ bhagavatā kriyate vyaṣṭi sṛṣṭiḥ
translated: But the creation of the particulars

original: tu brahmaṇā / samaṣṭisṛṣṭir nāma /
analyzed: tu brahmaṇā samaṣṭi sṛṣṭiḥ nāma
translated: is done by Brahma. The creation of the totality is

original: bhūtais tu pañcabhiḥ prāṇaiḥ svāntair daśabhir indriyaiḥ /
analyzed: bhūtaiḥ tu pañcabhiḥ prāṇaiḥ svāntaiḥ daśabhiḥ indriyaiḥ
translated: by the five elements, the five life-breaths, and the ten internal senses.

original: caturviṃśāti tattvāni sāṅkhyaśāstravido viduḥ //
analyzed: caturviṃśa ati tattvāni sāṅkhya śāstra vidaḥ viduḥ
translated: Those who know the Sankhya scriptures know the twenty-four principles.

original: mahān kālaḥ pradhānañ ca māyāvidyā ca pūruṣaḥ /
analyzed: mahān kālaḥ pradhānam ca māyā avidyā ca pūruṣaḥ
translated: The great one, time, the primordial matter, illusion, ignorance, and the soul,

original: iti paurāṇikāḥ prāhuḥ triṃśattatvāni tais saha //
analyzed: iti paurāṇikāḥ prāhuḥ triṃśat tatvāni taiḥ saha
translated: thus the Puranas speak of the thirty principles along with them.

original: vyaṣṭisṛṣṭilakṣaṇam
analyzed: vyaṣṭi sṛṣṭi lakṣaṇam
translated: The definition of the creation of the particulars

original: iti vacanāt tattvasṛṣṭir ity avagamyate / svāntair ity anena mano buddhir ahaṅkāraś cittañ ca karaṇāny amī ity antaḥkaraṇacatuṣṭayam
analyzed: iti vacanāt tattva sṛṣṭiḥ iti avagamyate svāntaiḥ iti anena manaḥ buddhiḥ ahaṅkāraḥ cittam ca karaṇāni amī iti antaḥkaraṇa catuṣṭayam
translated: From this statement, it is understood that the creation of principles is meant. By the word 'their own', the four internal organs - mind, intellect, ego, and citta - are mentioned.

original: ucyate / vyaṣṭisṛṣṭir nāma /
analyzed: ucyate vyaṣṭi sṛṣṭiḥ nāma
translated: This is called the creation of the individual.

original: aṇḍāntarvartibhūtajātasṛṣṭiḥ / ajām ekāṃ lohitaśuklakṛṣṇām nityo nityānām cetanaś
analyzed: aṇḍa antarvarti bhūta jāta sṛṣṭiḥ ajām ekām lohita śukla kṛṣṇām nityaḥ nityānām cetanaḥ
translated: The creation of the beings existing within the egg. The one unborn, red, white, and black, the eternal of the eternals, the conscious

original: cetanānām / ityādi śrutibhiḥ nityatvena śrutānāṃ prakṛtipuruṣānāṃ sṛṣṭir nāma pralayadaśāyāṃ🔽sūkṣmarūpeṇa avibhaktanāmarūpeṇa ca paramātmany ekībhūtānāṃ sṛṣṭikāle paramātmano
analyzed: cetanānām ityādi śrutibhiḥ nitya tvena śrutānām prakṛti puruṣānām sṛṣṭiḥ nāma pralaya daśāyām  sūkṣma rūpeṇa avibhakta nāma rūpeṇa ca paramātmani ekībhūtānām sṛṣṭi kāle paramātmanaḥ
translated: of the conscious beings, etc. - the creation of Prakriti and Purusha, which are heard as eternal by the Vedas, is called the creation. In the state of dissolution,🔽they become united in the form of subtle elements and undifferentiated name and form in the Supreme Self. At the time of creation, after the entry of the Supreme Self,

original: 'nupraveśānantaraṃ sthūlarūpavatvaṃ vibhaktanāmarūpabhāktvañ ca / tat sṛṣṭvā / tad
analyzed: anupraveśa anantaram sthūla rūpava tvam vibhakta nāma rūpa bhāj tvam ca tat sṛṣṭvā tat
translated: they attain the state of gross form and the state of having differentiated name and form. Having created that,

original: evānuprāviśat / tad anupraviśya / sac ca tyac cābhavat ityādi śruteḥ /
analyzed: eva anuprāviśat tat anupraviśya sat ca tyad ca abhavat ityādi śruteḥ
translated: it entered into that. Having entered that, it became both existent and non-existent, as stated in the Vedas.

original: viṣṇupurāṇe /
analyzed: viṣṇupurāṇe
translated: In the Vishnu Purana:

original: tad etad akṣayaṃ nityaṃ jaganmunivarākhilam /
analyzed: tat etat akṣayam nityam jagat muni vara akhilam
translated: This entire world, O best of sages, is imperishable and eternal,

original: avirbhāvatirobhāvajanmanāśavikalpavat // ViṣṇuP
analyzed: avirbhāva tirobhāva janma nāśa vikalpavat
translated: With the alternatives of appearance, disappearance, birth, and destruction. Vishnu

original: prakṛtiṃ puruṣañ caiva praviśyātmecchayā hariḥ /
analyzed: prakṛtim puruṣam ca eva praviśya ātma icchayā hariḥ
translated: Entering into Nature and the Spirit, Hari, by His own will,

original: kṣobhayāmāsa samprāpte sargakāle vyayāpyayau // iti ViṣṇuP
analyzed: kṣobhayāmāsa samprāpte sarga kāle vyaya apyayau iti viṣṇup
translated: agitated them at the time of creation, when dissolution and absorption were over. Thus in the Vishnu

original: gītāsu / prakṛtiṃ puruṣam caiva viddhy anādī ubhāv api / BhGī MBh / /
analyzed: gītāsu prakṛtim puruṣam ca eva viddhi anādī ubhau api
translated: Purana. Know that both Nature and the Spirit are beginningless.

original: mama yonir mahad brahma tasmin garbhaṃ dadhāmy aham /
analyzed: mama yoniḥ mahat brahma tasmin garbham dadhāmi aham
translated: My source is the great Brahman; in that I place the embryo.

original: sambhavas sarvabhūtānāṃ tato bhavati bhārata // BhGī MBh / /
analyzed: sambhavaḥ sarva bhūtānām tatas bhavati bhārata
translated: From that, O Bharata, the origin of all beings comes to be.

original: aṇḍotpattyādiprakāraḥ
analyzed: aṇḍa utpatti ādi prakāraḥ
translated: The process of the origin of the egg, etc.

original: iti coktarītyā sṛṣṭikāle jagadyonibhūtaṃ mahabrahma tadīyaṃ prakṛtyākhyam ācidvastu yat /🔽tasmin cetanākhyaṃ garbhaṃ yojayati / tatkṛtāc cidacitsaṃsargāt devādisthāvarāntānām
analyzed: iti ca ukta rītyā sṛṣṭi kāle jagat yoni bhūtam mahabrahma tadīyam prakṛti ākhyam ācit vastu yat  tasmin cetanā ākhyam garbham yojayati tad kṛtāt cit acit saṃsargāt deva ādi sthāvara antānām
translated: Thus, at the time of creation, in the great Brahman, which is the source of the universe, in that which is called Nature, the non-intelligent substance belonging to it,🔽He places the intelligent embryo. From the contact of the intelligent and non-intelligent created by that,

original: acinmiśrāṇāṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ sambhavo bhavati / evam eva paramātmanā pañcīkṛtānāṃ bhūtānāṃ
analyzed: acit miśrāṇām sarva bhūtānām sambhavaḥ bhavati evam eva paramātmanā pañcīkṛtānām bhūtānām
translated: the origin of all beings, mixed with non-intelligence, from gods to inanimate objects, comes to be. In the same way, of the elements that have been transformed into the five, by the Supreme Self,

original: anyonyasaṃyogādinā aṇḍoptattyādikaṃ śrīviṣṇupurāṇe pratipādyate / yathā /
analyzed: anyonya saṃyoga ādinā aṇḍa uptatti ādikam śrī viṣṇupurāṇe pratipādyate yathā
translated: the origin of the egg, etc., by mutual conjunction, etc., is taught in the Vishnu Purana. As follows:

original: ākāśavāyutejāṃsi salilaṃ pṛthivī tathā /
analyzed: ākāśa vāyu tejāṃsi salilam pṛthivī tathā
translated: Space, air, fire, water, and earth,

original: śabdādibhir guṇair bahmasaṃyuktāny uttarottaraiḥ // ViṣṇuP / /
analyzed: śabda ādibhiḥ guṇaiḥ bahma saṃyuktāni uttara uttaraiḥ
translated: united with the qualities of sound etc., progressively higher ones.

original: śāntā ghorāś ca mūḍhāś ca viśeṣās tena te smṛtāḥ /🔽nānāvīryāḥ pṛthagbhūtāḥ tataḥ te saṃhatiṃ vinā // ViṣṇuP
analyzed: śāntāḥ ghorāḥ ca mūḍhāḥ ca viśeṣāḥ tena te smṛtāḥ  nānā vīryāḥ pṛthak bhūtāḥ tatas te saṃhatim vinā
translated: They are remembered as peaceful, terrible, and deluded, due to that.

original: nāśaknuvan prajāḥ sraṣṭum asamāgamya kṛtsnaśaḥ /🔽sametyānyonyasaṃyogaṃ parasparasamāśrayāḥ // Viṣṇu /P
analyzed: na aśaknuvan prajāḥ sraṣṭum a samāgamya kṛtsnaśas  sametya anyonya saṃyogam paraspara samāśrayāḥ
translated: Having different potencies, they became separate, then they were unable to create beings without coming together completely.🔽Having come together, mutually united, mutually dependent,

original: ekasaṅghātalakṣyāś ca saṃprāpyaikyamaśeṣataḥ / ViṣṇuP / /
analyzed: eka saṅghāta lakṣyāḥ ca saṃprāpya aikyam aśeṣatas
translated: having attained oneness completely, with the goal of one aggregate,

original: puruṣādhiṣṭhitatvāc cāpy avyaktānugraheṇa ca // ViṣṇuP / /
analyzed: puruṣa dhiṣṭhita tvāt ca api avyakta anugraheṇa ca
translated: and due to being presided over by the Purusha and by the grace of the unmanifest,

original: mahadādyā viśeṣāntā hy aṇḍam utpādayanti te /
analyzed: mahat ādyāḥ viśeṣa antāḥ hi aṇḍam utpādayanti te
translated: the Mahat and the rest, ending with the specific, produce the egg.

original: tatkrameṇa prabuddhaṃ taj jalabudbudavatsamam /
analyzed: tad krameṇa prabuddham tat jala budbuda vat samam
translated: That, in due course, awakened, is like a water bubble, equal.

original: bhūtebhyo 'ṇḍaṃ mahābuddhe pravṛddham udakeśayam /
analyzed: bhūtebhyaḥ ṇḍam mahābuddhe pravṛddham udakeśayam
translated: O greatly wise one, the egg, born from the elements, grew in the water,

original: prākṛtaṃ brahmarūpasya viṣṇoḥ sthānam anuttamam // Viṣṇu /P / /
analyzed: prākṛtam brahma rūpasya viṣṇoḥ sthānam anuttamam
translated: the natural abode of Vishnu in the form of Brahman, unsurpassed.

original: tatrāvyaktasvarūpo 'sau vyaktarūpī jagatpatiḥ /
analyzed: tatra avyakta svarūpaḥ sau vyakta rūpī jagatpatiḥ
translated: There, he, of the form of the unmanifest, the lord of the world, of manifest form,

original: viṣṇur brahmasvarūpeṇa svayam eva vyavasthitaḥ // ViṣṇuP
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ brahma svarūpeṇa svayam eva vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Vishnu himself, in the form of Brahman, is established.

original: ity ārabhya
analyzed: iti ārabhya
translated: Beginning from here,

original: tasminn aṇḍe 'bhavad brahmā sadevāsuramānuṣaḥ // ViṣṇuP / /
analyzed: tasmin aṇḍe bhavat brahmā sa deva asura mānuṣaḥ viṣṇup
translated: In that egg, Brahmā was born, along with the gods, demons, and humans.

original: ityādibhiḥ samaṣṭisṛṣṭyādikam uktam / viśeṣeṇa vyaṣṭisṛṣṭāv api brahmaṇo 'ṇḍādiṣūtpattiprakāraḥ śrūyate / yathā /
analyzed: ityādibhiḥ samaṣṭi sṛṣṭi ādikam uktam viśeṣeṇa vyaṣṭi sṛṣṭau api brahmaṇaḥ ṇḍa ādiṣu utpatti prakāraḥ śrūyate yathā
translated: Thus, the creation of the universe and other topics are described. In particular, the way Brahmā is born from the egg and other things is heard in the special creation of the individual soul. As follows.

original: mahopaniṣadi /
translated: In the Mahā Upaniṣad.

original: athāto mahopaniṣadaṃ vyākhyāsyāmaḥ / eko ha vai nārāyaṇa āsīd ity ārabhya tasya
analyzed: atha atas mahā upaniṣadam vyākhyāsyāmaḥ ekaḥ ha vai nārāyaṇaḥ āsīt iti ārabhya tasya
translated: Now, we will explain the Mahā Upaniṣad. Beginning with Indeed, there was only one Nārāyaṇa,

original: dhyānāntassthasya yajñastomam ucyate / tasmin caturdaśapuruṣā jāyante / ekā kanyā /
analyzed: dhyāna antar sthasya yajñastomam ucyate tasmin caturdaśa puruṣāḥ jāyante ekā kanyā
translated: his sacrifice is said to be in the state of meditation. And in that, fourteen men are born, one girl.

original: daśendriyāṇi mana ekādaśaṃ tejo dvādaśam ahaṅkāraḥ trayodaśaḥ praṇāś caturdaśaḥ ātmā
analyzed: daśa indriyāṇi manaḥ ekādaśam tejaḥ dvādaśam ahaṅkāraḥ trayodaśaḥ praṇāḥ caturdaśaḥ ātmā
translated: The ten senses, the mind as the eleventh, the radiance as the twelfth, the ego as the thirteenth, the vital airs as the fourteenth, the self

original: pañcadaśaḥ buddhir bhūtāni pañca tanmātrāṇi pañca mahābhūtāni ca sa ekaḥ pañcaviṃśaḥ
analyzed: pañcadaśaḥ buddhiḥ bhūtāni pañca tanmātrāṇi pañca mahābhūtāni ca saḥ ekaḥ pañcaviṃśaḥ
translated: as the fifteenth, the intellect, the five elements, the five subtle elements, and the five great elements - he is the one twenty-fifth

original: puruṣaḥ / atha punar eva nārāyaṇas so 'nyatkāmo manasā dhyāyata tasya dhyānāntassthasya
analyzed: puruṣaḥ atha punar eva nārāyaṇaḥ saḥ nyatkāmaḥ manasā dhyāyata tasya dhyāna antassthasya
translated: man. Then again, that Nārāyaṇa, desiring something else, meditated with his mind. While he was in the state of meditation,

original: lalāṭāt svedo 'patat /🔽ta imāḥ pratatā āpaḥ /
analyzed: lalāṭāt svedaḥ patat  te imāḥ pratatāḥ āpaḥ
translated: sweat fell from his forehead.🔽Those are these extensive waters.

original: tāsu tejaḥ /
analyzed: tāsu tejaḥ
translated: In them is the radiance.

original: tat tejo hiraṇmayam aṇḍam tatra brahmā caturmukho 'jāyata / iti /
analyzed: tat tejaḥ hiraṇmayam aṇḍam tatra brahmā catur mukhaḥ jāyate iti
translated: That effulgence is the golden egg. In it, the four-faced Brahmā was born.

original: brahmaṇo 'ṇḍādiṣūtpattiprakāraḥ
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ ṇḍa ādiṣu utpatti prakāraḥ
translated: The mode of creation of Brahmā from the egg, etc.

original: yajuṣi / sa prajāpatir ekaḥ puṣkaraparṇe samabhavat iti ca /
analyzed: yajuṣi sa prajāpatiḥ ekaḥ puṣkaraparṇe samabhavat iti ca
translated: In the Yajur Veda. That Prajāpati came to be on the leaf of a lotus.

original: manau / evaṃ apa eva sasarjādau tāsu vīryam avāsṛjat //
analyzed: manau evam apaḥ eva sasarja ādau tāsu vīryam avāsṛjat
translated: In the Manava (Smṛti). In the beginning, he created only water. In them, he emitted his seed.

original: ity ārabhya ManuDhŚ /
analyzed: iti ārabhya
translated: Beginning from here, in the Manava Dharma Śāstra.

original: tasmin jajñe svayaṃ brahmā sarvalokapitāmahaḥ // iti ManuDhŚ /🔽bhārate / svapatas tasya devasya padmaṃ sūryasamaprabham /
analyzed: tasmin jajñe svayam brahmā sarva loka pitāmahaḥ iti  bhārate svapataḥ tasya devasya padmam sūrya sama prabham
translated: In him, Brahmā himself, the grandfather of all the worlds, was born.🔽In the Bhārata (Mahābhārata). From the navel of that sleeping god, a lotus appeared, having the splendor of the sun.

original: nābhyāṃ vinissṛtam abhūt tatrotpannaḥ prajāpatiḥ //
analyzed: nābhyām vinissṛtam abhūt tatra utpannaḥ prajāpatiḥ
translated: In it, Prajāpati was born.

original: iti ca smaryate / MBh / /
analyzed: iti ca smaryate mbh
translated: This is remembered.

original: nanu nābhyām aṇḍe cotpattir ekasya katham upapadyata iti cet tat kalpāntara iti vaktayam / taduktaṃ hayaśira upākhyāne /
analyzed: nanu nābhyām aṇḍe ca utpattiḥ ekasya katham upapadyate iti ced tat kalpa antare iti vaktayam tat uktam hayaśiraḥ upākhyāne
translated: If it is asked how the birth from the navel and the egg of one (Brahmā) is possible, it should be said that it is in another kalpa (period). That is said in the Hayagrīva Upa-Khāṇḍa (of the Padma Purāṇa).

original: ekasya brahmaṇaḥ nābhyām aṇḍe ca utpattiḥ🔽tvatto me mānasaṃ janma prathamaṃ dvijapūjitam /
analyzed: ekasya brahmaṇaḥ nābhyām aṇḍe ca utpattiḥ  tvattaḥ me mānasam janma prathamam dvija pūjitam
translated: The birth of the one Brahmā from the navel and the egg🔽My first birth was from your mind, revered by the twice-born.

original: cākṣuṣaṃ vai dvitīyaṃ me āsīj janma purātanam //
analyzed: cākṣuṣam vai dvitīyam me āsīt janma purātanam
translated: My second birth was from the eye, in the past.

original: tvatprasādāc ca me janma tṛtīyaṃ vācikaṃ mahat /
analyzed: tvad prasādāt ca me janma tṛtīyam vācikam mahat
translated: And by your grace, my third great birth was as a speaker.

original: tvatto me śrāvaṇañ cāpi caturthaṃ janma vai prabho //
analyzed: tvattaḥ me śrāvaṇam ca api caturtham janma vai prabho
translated: And, O Lord, my fourth birth was as a hearer from you.

original: nāsikyañ caiva me janma tvattaḥ pañcamam ucyate /
analyzed: nāsikyam ca eva me janma tvattaḥ pañcamam ucyate
translated: And my fifth birth is said to be as one born from the nose from you.

original: aṇḍajañ cāpi me janma tvattaḥ ṣaṣṭhaṃ vinirmittam //
analyzed: aṇḍa jam ca api me janma tvattaḥ ṣaṣṭham vinirmittam
translated: And my sixth birth was created by you as one born from an egg.

original: idan tu saptamaṃ janma padmajaṃ me 'mitaprabha / iti /
analyzed: idam tu saptamam janma padma jam me mita prabha iti
translated: And this is my seventh birth from a lotus, O you of infinite splendor.

original: caturmukhasya vaikhānasādiśabdavācyatvam
translated: The four-faced one is denoted by the words Vaikhānasa and others.

original: atas samastajagajjanmasthitidhvaṃsamahānandaikahetoḥ bhagavataḥ parabrahmaṇo
analyzed: atas samasta jagat janma sthiti dhvaṃsa mahānanda eka hetoḥ bhagavataḥ para brahmaṇaḥ
translated: Therefore, of the Lord, the Supreme Brahman, the sole cause of the birth, sustenance, and dissolution of the entire universe, and of great bliss,🔽since the words Vaikhānasa and others are applicable to Nārāyaṇa,

original: nārāyaṇasya vaikhānasādiśabdavācyatvasambhavāt tannābhinalinasañjātasya brahmaṇo
analyzed: nārāyaṇasya vaikhānasa ādi śabda vācya tva sambhavāt tad nābhi nalina sañjātasya brahmaṇaḥ
translated: Brahmā, born from the lotus in his navel,

original: 'pi aṅgād aṅgād iti mantroktaprakāreṇa bhāratādipratipāditarītyā ca vaikhānasādiśabdavācyatvam upapadyate /
analyzed: aṅgāt aṅgāt iti mantra ukta prakāreṇa bhārata ādi pratipādita rītyā ca vaikhānasa ādi śabda vācya tvam upapadyate
translated: is also denoted by the words Vaikhānasa and others in the manner stated by the mantra from limb to limb and in the manner presented by the Bhārata and others.

original: śāntiparvaṇi /
analyzed: śāntiparvaṇi
translated: In the Śāntiparva (of the Mahābhārata).

original: viśeṣeṇākhanat yasmāt bhāvanāmunisṛṣṭaye /
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa akhanat yasmāt bhāvanā muni sṛṣṭaye
translated: Since he dug out (the earth) especially for the creation of the sages born from mental disposition,

original: tasmād vikhanaso nāma sa āsīd aṇḍajaḥ priyaḥ // iti MBh
analyzed: tasmāt vikhanasaḥ nāma saḥ āsīt aṇḍa jaḥ priyaḥ iti mbh
translated: therefore he was called Vaikhānasa, born from an egg, and dear (to Viṣṇu). (BhP 1.3.1)

original: yeṣāṃ trīṇy avadātāni yonirvidyā ca karma ca /
analyzed: yeṣām trīṇi avadātāni yoniḥ vidyā ca karma ca
translated: Those whose three things are pure, whose birth, knowledge, and action,

original: te sevyās tais samāsyā hi śāstrebhyo 'pi garīyasī // ti MBh / /
analyzed: te sevyāḥ taiḥ samāsyā hi śāstrebhyaḥ pi garīyasī
translated: they should be served by those, for this association is greater even than the scriptures.

original: ānandasaṃhitānusāreṇa vaikhānasotpattyādikam
analyzed: ānandasaṃhitā anusāreṇa vaikhānasa utpatti ādikam
translated: The origination etc. of the Vaikhānasa ascetics according to the Ānanda Saṃhitā

original: śrīvaikhānase ānandasaṃhitāyāṃ vikhanasotpattyādikaṃ pratipāditam /🔽atha sasmāra bhagavān viśvasṛṣṭyartham acyutaḥ /
analyzed: śrī vaikhānase ānanda saṃhitāyām vikhanasa utpatti ādikam pratipāditam  atha sasmāra bhagavān viśva sṛṣṭi artham acyutaḥ
translated: In the Ananda Samhita of the revered Vaikhanasa school, the origin of the sages and other topics are presented.

original: dhātāraṃ viśvanirmāṇacaturaṃ caturānanam // ĀS /🔽smaraṇānantarād eva prādur āsīt puraḥ prabhoḥ /
analyzed: dhātāram viśva nirmāṇa caturam caturānanam  smaraṇa anantarāt eva prādur āsīt puras prabhoḥ
translated: Then, the imperishable Lord remembered the creator, the four-faced one, skilled in creating the universe, for the purpose of creating the universe.

original: dhātā samastajagatām utpattikaraṇakṣamaḥ // Ā /S /
analyzed: dhātā samasta jagatām utpatti karaṇa kṣamaḥ
translated: Immediately after being remembered, the creator, capable of creating all the worlds, appeared before the Lord.

original: taṃ prāha bhagavān viṣṇuḥ praṇataṃ purataḥ sthitam /
analyzed: tam prāha bhagavān viṣṇuḥ praṇatam puratas sthitam
translated: The Lord Vishnu said to him, bowing and standing before him:

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Lord said:

original: brahman tvayā jagat sarvaṃ kartavyaṃ sacarācaram // ĀS /
analyzed: brahman tvayā jagat sarvam kartavyam sacarācaram
translated: O Brahman, by you, the entire world with its moving and unmoving beings, must be created.

original: loke vihartum icchāmi yad ahaṃ padmasambhava /
analyzed: loke vihartum icchāmi yat aham padmasambhava
translated: O lotus-born one, I wish to sport in the world.

original: tatas tvatsṛṣṭajagatām avicchinnapravṛttaye /
analyzed: tatas tvad sṛṣṭa jagatām avicchinna pravṛttaye
translated: Then, for the uninterrupted continuation of the world created by you,

original: dharmasaṃrakṣaṇārthāya vedaśāstrārthasiddhaye // ĀS /
analyzed: dharma saṃrakṣaṇa arthāya veda śāstra artha siddhaye
translated: for the protection of Dharma, and for the establishment of the meaning of the Vedas and scriptures.

original: alasā alpasattvāś ca manuṣyās svalpabuddhayaḥ /
analyzed: alasāḥ alpa sattvāḥ ca manuṣyāḥ su alpabuddhayaḥ
translated: Men are lazy, of little strength, and of little understanding.

original: te paravyūhavibhavān ātmānāñ ca na menire // ĀS /
analyzed: te para vyūha vibhavān ātmānām ca na menire
translated: They do not consider the grandeur of others' arrangements and their own.

original: ānandasaṃhitānusāreṇa sanakādisṛṣṭiḥ
analyzed: ānanda saṃhitā anusāreṇa sanaka ādi sṛṣṭiḥ
translated: The creation of Sanaka and others according to the Anandsamhita

original: saulabhyāya tu bhaktānāṃ sarvalokānukampayā // ĀS /
analyzed: saulabhyāya tu bhaktānām sarva loka anukampayā
translated: For the ease of devotees and out of compassion for all the worlds.

original: arcāvatārarūpeṇa loke 'smiṃś caturānana /
analyzed: arcā avatāra rūpeṇa loke smin caturānana
translated: O Four-faced One, in the form of an incarnation in the worship,

original: avatāraṃ kariṣyāmi mahyā lakṣmyā samanvitaḥ // Ā /S /
analyzed: avatāram kariṣyāmi mahyā lakṣmyā samanvitaḥ
translated: I will take an incarnation in this world, endowed with my own Lakshmi.

original: madarcāyai sṛja brahman sṛṣṭyādau munisattamaṃ / ĀS /🔽ity ājñaptas tadā brahmā muhūrtaṃ tat sisṛkṣayā /
analyzed: mad arcāyai sṛja brahman sṛṣṭi ādau muni sattamam  iti ājñaptaḥ tadā brahmā muhūrtam tat sisṛkṣayā
translated: For my worship, create the best of sages in the beginning of creation, O Brahma.🔽Thus commanded, Brahma then, for a moment, with the desire to create,

original: cintayāmāsa tatkarmā kṣaṇam ekaṃ mahāmuniḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: cintayāmāsa tad karmā kṣaṇam ekam mahā muniḥ
translated: The great sage thought about that task for a moment.

original: ūcuḥ na śaknuyām evaṃ sraṣṭum icchan tathāvidham /
analyzed: ūcuḥ na śaknuyām evam sraṣṭum icchan tathāvidham
translated: They said, I cannot create such a one, desiring to create.

original: tasya tad vacanaṃ śrutvā devadevo haris svayam // Ā /S
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā devadevaḥ hariḥ svayam
translated: Having heard those words of his, the Lord of gods, Hari himself,

original: cintayāmāsa deveśaḥ svanirmalatarātmani /
analyzed: cintayāmāsa deveśaḥ sva nirmalatara ātmani
translated: The Lord of gods thought in his own very pure self.

original: vedāntatattvamīmāṃsā khananaṃ kṛtavān hariḥ // ĀS /
translated: Hari dug up the Vedanta philosophy.

original: nāmnā vikhanasaṃ cakre tatpadānvarthayogataḥ /
analyzed: nāmnā vikhanasam cakre tad pada anvartha yogataḥ
translated: He named it Vikhana in accordance with its meaning.

original: tathā cintayatas tasya manaso dvau babhūvatuḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: tathā cintayataḥ tasya manasaḥ dvau babhūvatuḥ
translated: And as he was thinking thus, two things arose in his mind.

original: saṅkalpadharmau sannamya prāñjaliṃ purataḥ sthitam / ĀS / /
analyzed: saṅkalpa dharmau sannamya prāñjalim puratas sthitam
translated: Bowing to the two mental qualities of resolution and virtue, standing with folded hands in front,🔽Vishnu spoke to Brahma for the sake of the end of creation.

original: brahmāṇam abravīd viṣṇur bhūtasṛṣṭyantahetave kārakaṃ /
analyzed: brahmāṇam abravīt viṣṇuḥ bhūta sṛṣṭi anta hetave kārakam
translated: The creator.

original: saṅkalpadharmau bhavatas tava sṛṣṭyantahetave //
analyzed: saṅkalpa dharmau bhavataḥ tava sṛṣṭi anta hetave
translated: You are the cause of creation and dissolution.

original: śuddhasattvasamutpanno nirmito 'yaṃ tavāgrataḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: śuddha sattva samutpannaḥ nirmitaḥ yam tava agratas
translated: This Nirmita, born of pure sattva, is created in front of you.

original: muniśreṣṭho mahātejā matkāryakaraṇakṣamaḥ / ĀS / /
analyzed: muni śreṣṭhaḥ mahā tejāḥ mad kārya karaṇa kṣamaḥ
translated: He is the best of sages, of great splendor, capable of accomplishing my task.

original: matkāryasādhakān eva tvaṃ vai sraṣṭum athārhasi //
analyzed: mad kārya sādhakān eva tvam vai sraṣṭum atha arhasi
translated: You are worthy of creating only those who will accomplish my task.

original: hṛṣīkeśasya tadvākyaṃ bhyādhāya kṛtañjaliḥ /
analyzed: hṛṣīkeśasya tat vākyam bhyādhāya kṛtañjaliḥ
translated: Having accepted those words of Hrishikesha with folded hands,

original: caturmukhaś cāpi tathā sanakādimunīśvarān /
analyzed: caturmukhaḥ ca api tathā sanaka ādi muni īśvarān
translated: The four-faced one also created the great sages Sanaka and others,

original: dhyāyan mukhaiś caturbhis tu kramād asṛjad abjabhūḥ //
analyzed: dhyāyan mukhaiḥ caturbhiḥ tu kramāt asṛjat abja bhūḥ
translated: The lotus-born one, meditating with his four faces, created them in order.

original: ānandasaṃhitānusāreṇa dakṣādimunidaśakasṛṣṭiḥ
translated: The creation of the ten sages beginning with Daksha according to the Anandsashtaka

original: sanatkumārañ ca tathā sanakañ ca sanātanam /
analyzed: sanatkumāram ca tathā sanakam ca sanātanam
translated: Sanatkumara, Sanaka, Sanatana,

original: sanandanam iti khyātān brahmavidyāviśāradān // ĀS /
analyzed: sanandanam iti khyātān brahma vidyā viśāradān
translated: And Sanandana, renowned as experts in the knowledge of Brahman.

original: tatas te ca muniśreṣṭhā jñānātiśayavaibhavāt /
analyzed: tatas te ca muni śreṣṭhāḥ jñāna atiśaya vaibhavāt
translated: Then those best of sages, by the power of their great knowledge,

original: viraktacittās sañjagmuḥ kaivalyaṃ padam uttamaṃ // ĀS /
analyzed: virakta cittāḥ sañjagmuḥ kaivalyam padam uttamam
translated: With detached minds, went to the supreme state of liberation.

original: svakāryasādhakān brahmā sṛṣṭavān punar eva hi /
analyzed: sva kārya sādhakān brahmā sṛṣṭavān punar eva hi
translated: Brahma again created those who would accomplish his own task,

original: prāṇāc ca cakṣuṣas tadvad abhimānāc ca karmaṇaḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: prāṇāt ca cakṣuṣaḥ tadvat abhimānāt ca karmaṇaḥ
translated: From prana, from the eye, from abhimāna, and from action.

original: hṛdayāc chirasaḥ śrotrād udānād vyānatas tataḥ /
analyzed: hṛdayāt śirasaḥ śrotrāt udānāt vyānataḥ tatas
translated: From the heart, from the head, from the ears, from the upward moving breath, from the diffusive breath,

original: samānāc ca tathāpānād ṛṣiśreṣṭhān imān daśa // ĀS /
analyzed: samānāt ca tathā apānāt ṛṣi śreṣṭhān imān daśa
translated: And from the downward moving breath, O best of sages, these ten.

original: dakṣaṃ marīcinaṃ nīlalohitaṃ bhṛgum eva ca /
analyzed: dakṣam marīcinam nīlalohitam bhṛgum eva ca
translated: Daksha, Marichi, Nila, Lohita, Bhrigu,

original: tathāṅgirasam atriṃ ca pulastyaṃ pulahaṃ tathā // ĀS /
analyzed: tathā aṅgirasam atrim ca pulastyam pulaham tathā
translated: And Angiras, Atri, Pulastya, Pulaha,

original: vasiṣṭhaṃ ca kratuṃ caiva kramād asṛjad abjabhūḥ /
analyzed: vasiṣṭham ca kratum ca eva kramāt asṛjat abjabhūḥ
translated: And Vasishtha, Kratu - the lotus-born one created them in order.

original: nava brahmāṇa evaite vinā syur nīlalohitaṃ // ĀS /
analyzed: nava brahmāṇaḥ eva ete vinā syuḥ nīlalohitam
translated: These nine Brahmas would be without Nila Lohita.

original: ānandasaṃhitānusāreṇa vaikhānasasya muniśreṣṭhatvam
analyzed: ānanda saṃhitā anusāreṇa vaikhānasasya muni śreṣṭha tvam
translated: According to the Anandsamhita, the Vaikhanasa is the best of sages.

original: dharmasaṅkalpasahitās sanakādyā munīśvarāḥ /
analyzed: dharma saṅkalpa sahitāḥ sanaka ādyāḥ muni īśvarāḥ
translated: The great sages Sanaka and others, along with Dharma and Sankalpa,

original: bhṛgvādimunayaś caiva śrutismṛtyādivedanāt // ĀS /
analyzed: bhṛgu ādi munayaḥ ca eva śruti smṛti ādi vedanāt
translated: And the sages Bhrigu and others, are known from the Vedas, scriptures, and other sources.

original: śiṣyā vikhanasaḥ proktās sarvaśāstrārthapāragāḥ /
analyzed: śiṣyāḥ vikhanasaḥ proktāḥ sarva śāstra artha pāragāḥ
translated: They are said to be the disciples of Vikhanas, masters of all scriptures.

original: vaikhānasānāṃ bhṛgvādyā vaṃśakartāra īritāḥ // Ā /S /
analyzed: vaikhānasānām bhṛgu ādyāḥ vaṃśa kartāraḥ īritāḥ
translated: The founders of the Vaikhanasa lineage are said to be Bhrigu and others.

original: sarveṣām agrajaṃ śreṣṭham ātmaputraṃ muniṃ tathā /
analyzed: sarveṣām agrajam śreṣṭham ātma putram munim tathā
translated: He is the eldest and best of all, and the sage is also his own son.

original: taṃ hareḥ purataḥ kṛtvā proktavān kamalāsanaḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: tam hareḥ puratas kṛtvā proktavān kamalāsanaḥ
translated: Placing him in front of Hari, the lotus-seated one said:

original: brahmovāca /
analyzed: brahmā uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

original: devadeva jagannātha sṛṣṭisthityantakāraṇa /
analyzed: devadeva jagannātha sṛṣṭi sthiti anta kāraṇa
translated: God of gods, lord of the universe, cause of creation, sustenance, and dissolution,

original: bhagavaṃs tvatprabhāvena sṛṣṭo 'yaṃ munisattamaḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: bhagavan tvad prabhāvena sṛṣṭaḥ yam muni sattamaḥ
translated: O Lord, by your power, this best of sages has been created.

original: jātāḥ cintayato mattas tvat sṛṣṭau munayas tv ime /
analyzed: jātāḥ cintayataḥ mattaḥ tvat sṛṣṭau munayaḥ tu ime
translated: These sages have been born from me, thinking of them in your creation.

original: etair api kṛtaṃ sarvaṃ jagad etac carācaraṃ // ĀS /
analyzed: etaiḥ api kṛtam sarvam jagat etat carācaram
translated: By them also, this entire world of the moving and unmoving has been created.

original: matputrāṇāṃ ca sarveṣām agrajaḥ puruṣottamaḥ /
analyzed: mad putrāṇām ca sarveṣām agrajaḥ puruṣottamaḥ
translated: The best of men is the eldest of all my sons.

original: vaiṣṇaveṣv agrajaś śreṣṭho munīnāṃ prathamo muniḥ // Ā /S /
analyzed: vaiṣṇaveṣu agrajaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ munīnām prathamaḥ muniḥ
translated: He is the eldest and best of the followers of Vishnu, the first sage of the sages.

original: ānandasaṃhitānusāreṇa vaikhānasya garbhavaiṣṇavatvam
analyzed: ānanda saṃhitā anusāreṇa vaikhānasya garbha vaiṣṇava tvam
translated: The Vaikhanasa's status as a future Vaishnava according to the Ananda Samhita

original: viśeṣakhananāj jāto viṣṇor vaikhānasas tathā /
analyzed: viśeṣa khananāt jātaḥ viṣṇoḥ vaikhānasaḥ tathā
translated: And the Vaikhanasa of Vishnu is born from the special excavation.

original: bhṛgvādīn upanīyātha sāvitrīm upadekṣyati // ĀS /
analyzed: bhṛgu ādīn upanīya atha sāvitrīm upadekṣyati
translated: Having initiated Bhrigu and others, he will teach the Savitri.

original: parabrahmopadeṣṭāsāv ayam eva gurus smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: para brahma upadeṣṭā asau ayam eva guruḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: This one is remembered as the guru who teaches the supreme Brahman.

original: etad uktaprakāreṇa sarve vai mama sūnavaḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: etat ukta prakāreṇa sarve vai mama sūnavaḥ
translated: In this way mentioned, all of them are my sons.

original: cariṣyanti yathānyāyaṃ laukikādhyātmavaidikān /
analyzed: cariṣyanti yathānyāyam laukika adhyātma vaidikān
translated: They will duly practice the worldly, spiritual and Vedic paths.

original: ebhiḥ pravartitā sṛṣṭir avicchinnā pravarttate // ĀS /
analyzed: ebhiḥ pravartitā sṛṣṭiḥ avicchinnā pravarttate
translated: The creation started by them continues uninterrupted.

original: bhavān avataratv atra mama sṛṣṭau janārdana /
analyzed: bhavān avataratu atra mama sṛṣṭau janārdana
translated: O Janardana, you descend into my creation here.

original: śuddhasattvasamutpanno nirmito 'yaṃ tvayā vibho // ĀS /
analyzed: śuddha sattva samutpannaḥ nirmitaḥ yam tvayā vibho
translated: This Nirmita (created being) has arisen from pure Sattva, O Lord.

original: ṛṣiśreṣṭho mahātejāḥ tvatkarmakaraṇakṣamaḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣi śreṣṭhaḥ mahā tejāḥ tvad karma karaṇa kṣamaḥ
translated: The best of sages, of great splendor, is capable of performing your deeds.

original: tathāsau khananād viṣṇoḥ dhyāyād antaś ca garbhataḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: tathā asau khananāt viṣṇoḥ dhyāyāt antar ca garbhataḥ
translated: Thus he, from the digging, of Vishnu, meditates within the womb, Ās.

original: yasmāt tava samutpanno jñeyo 'sau garbhavaiṣṇavaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt tava samutpannaḥ jñeyaḥ sau garbha vaiṣṇavaḥ
translated: Since he has arisen from you, he should be known as Garbhavāiṣṇava (Vishnu in the womb).

original: ity ukto bhagavān prāha muniśreṣṭhaṃ taponidhiṃ // Ā /S /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ bhagavān prāha muni śreṣṭham tapaḥ nidhim
translated: Thus addressed, the Lord said to the best of sages, the treasure of austerities, Ās.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: devabrahma ṛṣīṇān tu madīyārādhanaṃ prati /
analyzed: deva brahma ṛṣīṇām tu madīya ārādhanam prati
translated: To the gods, Brahmins and sages, for the sake of my worship,

original: mayā sañcodito yasmāt tvam eva munisattama // ĀS /
analyzed: mayā sañcoditaḥ yasmāt tvam eva muni sattamaḥ
translated: since you have been urged by me, O best of sages, Ās.

original: tapodhano bhavān eva dhanyo 'si bhuvanatraye /
analyzed: tapodhanaḥ bhavān eva dhanyaḥ si bhuvanatraye
translated: You alone are the treasure of austerities, you are blessed in the three worlds.

original: ātmārthaṃ vā parārthaṃ vā nityanaimittikādi yat // Ā /S /
analyzed: ātma artham vā para artham vā nitya naimittika ādi yat
translated: For one's own sake or for the sake of others, whatever is done as a regular duty or occasional duty, Ās.

original: tat sarvaṃ matprasādena madīyārādhanaṃ kuru /
analyzed: tat sarvam mad prasādena madīya ārādhanam kuru
translated: All that, by my grace, is my worship. Perform my worship.

original: athāha sa ṛṣis tasmai praṇamya jagadātmane // ĀS /
analyzed: atha āha saḥ ṛṣiḥ tasmai praṇamya jagadātmane
translated: Then the sage, bowing to him, the Self of the world, said, Ās.

original: ānandasaṃhitānusāreṇa vaikhānasānām advārakabhagavadyajanena nityakarmānuṣṭānapūrṇatā
analyzed: ānanda saṃhitā anusāreṇa vaikhānasānām advāraka bhagavat yajanena nityakarma anuṣṭāna pūrṇa tā
translated: The perfection of the performance of daily duties according to the Ānanda Saṃhitā by the Vaikhānasas through the worship of the doorless Lord

original: śrīvikhānā uvāca /
analyzed: śrī vikhānā uvāca
translated: Śrī Vaikhānasa said:

original: bhavatānugṛhīto 'haṃ dhanyo 'smi puruṣottama /
analyzed: bhavatā anugṛhītaḥ ham dhanyaḥ smi puruṣottama
translated: O best of men, I am blessed, having been favored by you.

original: nātaḥ parataraṃ kāryaṃ kim apy anyad divaukasām // ĀS /🔽tathāpi devadeveśa svakarma munibhis sadā /
analyzed: na atas parataram kāryam kim api anyat divaukasām  tathā api devadeveśa sva karma munibhiḥ sadā
translated: There is no other task for the dwellers of heaven that is superior to this.

original: udayādyastaparyantaṃ kriyate niyatātmabhiḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: udaya ādi asta paryantam kriyate niyata ātmabhiḥ
translated: O Lord of the Lord of gods, even so, the self-imposed duties of the sages are always performed by those with controlled minds,🔽from sunrise to sunset.

original: sarveṣāñ ca dvijātīnāṃ śrutismṛtisamīritam /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca dvijātīnām śruti smṛti samīritam
translated: And for all the twice-born, what is enjoined by the Vedas and Smritis,

original: kartavyaṃ satataṃ deva svasvakarma prayatnataḥ // Ā /S /
analyzed: kartavyam satatam deva sva sva karma prayatnataḥ
translated: O Lord, should always be performed with effort, one's own duty.

original: bhavadārādhanaṃ viṣṇo kathaṃ kāraṃ karomy ahaṃ /
analyzed: bhavat ārādhanam viṣṇo katham kāram karomi aham
translated: O Vishnu, how should I perform your worship?

original: tvatkarma kriyate cet tu karmalopo bhaven mama /
analyzed: tvad karma kriyate ced tu karma lopaḥ bhavet mama
translated: If I were to do your duty, there would be an omission of my own duties.

original: ity ukto bhagavān āha muninā tattvavedinā // ĀS /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ bhagavān āha muninā tattva vedinā
translated: Thus addressed, the Lord was told by the sage who knew the truth.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /🔽vikhanas tvaṃ muniśreṣṭha madārādhanakarmaṇi // ĀS /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca  vikhanaḥ tvam muni śreṣṭha mad ārādhana karmaṇi
translated: The Blessed Lord said:🔽O best of sages, O Vāmana, in the performance of the worship of me,

original: svakarmalopasaṃtrāsavyākulīkṛtacetasaḥ /
analyzed: sva karma lopa saṃtrāsa vyākulīkṛta cetasaḥ
translated: your mind is agitated by the fear of omission of your own duties.

original: tava karmāṇy anūnāni saṃtu nityaṃ madājñayā // ĀS /

original: kṛtādhikāriṇas te tu kṛtasambandhino mama // ĀS /🔽matprasādabhujas saumyā atipriyatamā mama /

analyzed: ṣaṭkarma niratāḥ te vai sāttvika āhāra tatparāḥ

analyzed: vaikhānasena sūtreṇa niṣeka ādi kriyā anvitāḥ
translated: Endowed with the rites beginning with impregnation by the thread of the Vaikhānasa school,

analyzed: bhavanti bhāvitātmānaḥ mad karma karaṇa kṣamāḥ
translated: They become purified souls, capable of performing my rites.

analyzed: tasmāt bhāgavata śreṣṭhāḥ bhavanti aprākṛtāḥ bhuvi

analyzed: sarva dhāḥ ye nakhāḥ te vaikhānasāḥ iti vedataḥ

analyzed: tasmāt vaikhānasāḥ śuddhāḥ sarva karmasu pūjitāḥ

analyzed: tatas prāha muni śreṣṭhaḥ tam evam vādinam harim
translated: Then the best of sages spoke to Lord Hari, who was speaking thus:

original: śrīvikhanāḥ /
analyzed: śrīvikhanāḥ

original: bhagavaṃs tvatprasādena karma sāṅgaṃ yathoditaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavan tvad prasādena karma sa aṅgam yathā uditam

original: atha pañcamavedatvena prasiddhe mahābhārate ānuśāsanikaparvaṇi adhyāye bhṛgvādimaharṣīṇāṃ vaikhānasānāñ cotpattiḥ nirūpitā /

original: vasiṣṭha / api cedaṃ purā rāma śrutaṃ me brahmadarśanam /
analyzed: vasiṣṭha api ca idam purā rāma śrutam me brahma darśanam

translated: All the sages came, and the gods led by Agni,🔽and all the parts of the sacrifice, and Vashatkara in embodied form.

analyzed: sañjuhāva ātmanā ātmānam svayam eva tathā prabho

analyzed: deva patnyaḥ ca kanyāḥ ca devānām ca eva mātaraḥ
translated: The wives of the gods, the maidens, and the mothers of the gods,

analyzed: ājagmuḥ sahitāḥ tatra tadā bhṛgukulodvaha

analyzed: yajñam paśupateḥ prītāḥ varuṇasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Delighted, they attended the sacrifice of the great lord Varuna, the lord of beings.

analyzed: svayaṃbhuvaḥ tu tāḥ dṛṣṭvā retaḥ samapatat bhuvi
translated: But the Self-Existent One, seeing them, emitted his seed on the ground.

original: tasya śukrasya niṣṣyandāt pāṃsūn saṃgṛhya bhūmitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya śukrasya niṣṣyandāt pāṃsūn saṃgṛhya bhūmitaḥ
translated: From the falling of that semen, the dust of the earth was collected.

analyzed: prāsyat pūṣā karābhyām vai tasmin eva hutāśane

analyzed: tatas tasmin saṃpravṛtte satre jvalita pāvake
translated: Then, when that sacrifice with blazing fire was commenced,

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ juhvataḥ tatra prādurbhāvaḥ babhūva ha

analyzed: tatas tu janayāmāsa bhūta grāmam sa vīryavān
translated: Then that powerful one generated the groups of beings.

analyzed: sa guṇaḥ tejasaḥ nityaḥ tasya ca ākāśam eva ca

analyzed: bhṛk iti eva bhṛguḥ pūrvam aṅgārebhyaḥ ṅgirāḥ bhavat

analyzed: samutpannau aśvinau loka saṃmatau

translated: The sages were born from his pores, the meters from his sweat, and the mind from his strength.

analyzed: yāni dārūṇi te māsāḥ niryāsāḥ pakṣa saṃjñitāḥ

original: ahorātrā muhūrtās tu pittaṃ jyotiś ca vāruṇam // MBh / /
analyzed: ahar rātrāḥ muhūrtāḥ tu pittam jyotiḥ ca vāruṇam
translated: The days and nights are the Muhurtas, and the bile is the Varuṇa light.

original: raudraṃ lohitam ity āhur lohitāt kanakaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: raudram lohitam iti āhuḥ lohitāt kanakam smṛtam
translated: They say the Raudra is the red, and from the red, gold is remembered.

analyzed: tat maitram iti vijñeyam dhūmāt ca vasavaḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: That should be known as the Maitra, and from the smoke, the Vasus are remembered.

original: arciṣo yāś ca te rudrās tathādityā mahāprabhāḥ /
analyzed: arciṣaḥ yāḥ ca te rudrāḥ tathā ādityāḥ mahā prabhāḥ

original: kalpe kalpe kṣayotpattyā brahmaviṣṇumaheśvarāḥ /
analyzed: kalpe kalpe kṣaya utpattyā brahma viṣṇu maheśvarāḥ
translated: Brahma, Vishnu and Maheshvara, by destruction and origination in each kalpa,

original: śrutismṛtisadācāra nirṇetāras tu sarvadā //
analyzed: śruti smṛti sat ācāra nirṇetāraḥ tu sarvadā
translated: are always the determiners of the Vedas, Smritis and good conduct.

original: na kāścid vedakartā 'sti vedavaktā caturmukhaḥ /
analyzed: na kāścid veda kartā sti veda vaktā caturmukhaḥ
translated: There is no author of the Vedas, and the four-faced one is the expounder of the Vedas.

original: tathaiva dharmaṃ smarati manuḥ kalpāntarāntare //
analyzed: tathā eva dharmam smarati manuḥ kalpa antara antare
translated: In the same way, Manu remembers the Dharma in each kalpa.

original: tṛtīyāśramaniṣṭhānāṃ na naisargikaṃ vaikhānasatvam
analyzed: tṛtīya āśrama niṣṭhānām na naisargikam vaikhānasa tvam
translated: For those who are established in the third stage of life, the nature of being a Vaikhanasa is not natural.

original: nanu / brahmacārī gṛhasthaś ca bhikṣur vaikhānasas tathā iti tatra tatra
analyzed: nanu brahmacārī gṛhasthaḥ ca bhikṣuḥ vaikhānasaḥ tathā iti tatra tatra
translated: But it is said here and there: The celibate, the householder, the mendicant, and the Vaikhanasa etc.

original: tṛtīyāśramaniṣṭhānām eva vaikhānasatvāvagamāt ta eva vaikhānasaśabdavācyāḥ kiṃ na
analyzed: tṛtīya āśrama niṣṭhānām eva vaikhānasa tva avagamāt te eva vaikhānasa śabda vācyāḥ kim na
translated: If it is asked why they who are established in the third stage of life are not called Vaikhānasa, because it is understood that they alone are Vaikhānasa,

original: syur iti cet na / śrutismṛtipurāṇādiṣu uktaprakāreṇa brahmaṇā sṛṣṭānām eva vaikhānasatvāvagamāt
analyzed: syuḥ iti ced na śruti smṛti purāṇa ādiṣu ukta prakāreṇa brahmaṇā sṛṣṭānām eva vaikhānasa tva avagamāt
translated: no, because it is understood that only those created by Brahmā in the manner stated in the Vedas, Smṛtis, Purāṇas, etc. are Vaikhānasa,

original: teṣām eva tatra tatrotkṛṣṭatvapratipādanāc ca /
analyzed: teṣām eva tatra tatra utkṛṣṭa tva pratipādanāt ca
translated: and because their excellence is taught in various places.

original: vaikhānasānāṃ brahmasabhāpraveśaḥ
analyzed: vaikhānasānām brahma sabhā praveśaḥ
translated: The entry of the Vaikhānasa into the assembly of Brahmā

original: tathā hi / śrutāv eva vaikhānasānām utpattiḥ śrūyate / ye nakhāḥ te vaikhānasāḥ iti / chandogyabrāhmaṇe /
analyzed: tathā hi śrutau eva vaikhānasānām utpattiḥ śrūyate ye nakhāḥ te vaikhānasāḥ iti chandogyabrāhmaṇe
translated: Thus, in the Vedas themselves, the origin of the Vaikhānasa is heard: Those who are nails are the Vaikhānasa in the Chāndogya Brāhmaṇa.

original: vaikhānasā vā ṛṣaya indrasya priyā āsan🔽pauruhan mahaṃ bhavati / puruhānnādo vā etena vaikhānaso 'ñjasā svargaṃ🔽lokam apaśyat iti / atra indraśabdena paramātmā nārāyaṇa ucyate / sa brahmā sa śivassendrasso
analyzed: vaikhānasāḥ vai ṛṣayaḥ indrasya priyāḥ āsan  pauruhat maham bhavati puruhā anna ādaḥ vai etena vaikhānasaḥ ñjasā svargam  lokam apaśyat iti atra indra śabdena paramātmā nārāyaṇaḥ ucyate sa brahmā sa śivaḥ sa indraḥ saḥ
translated: The sages Vaikhānasa were dear to Indra.

original: 'kṣaraḥ paramas svarāṭ ityādi śrutibhyaḥ /
analyzed: kṣaraḥ paramaḥ svarāj ityādi śrutibhyaḥ
translated: It is about Puruhāṇ. By this, the Vaikhānasa Puruhāṇādatta saw heaven directly. Here, by the word Indra, the Supreme Self Nārāyaṇa is meant, because of Vedic statements such as He is Brahmā, He is Śiva, He is Indra, He is the imperishable Supreme King.

original: āśvatthaḥ kapilā gāvas tulasī vikhanās tathā /
analyzed: āśvatthaḥ kapilāḥ gāvaḥ tulasī vikhanāḥ tathā
translated: The holy fig tree, the tawny cows, the tulasī plant, and the Vaikhānasa,

original: catvāro matpriyā rājaṃs teṣāṃ vaikhānaso varaḥ // ĀS /
analyzed: catvāraḥ mad priyāḥ rājan teṣām vaikhānasaḥ varaḥ
translated: O king, these four are dear to me, among them the Vaikhānasa is the best.

original: ity upabrahmaṇāt / brahmasūtre indraprāṇādhikaraṇe tathā nirṇayāc ca /
analyzed: iti upabrahmaṇāt brahmasūtre indra prāṇa adhikaraṇe tathā nirṇayāt ca
translated: Thus it is stated in the Upabrahmaṇa, and because it is determined in the Brahmasūtra in the section on Indra and Prāṇa.

original: ānuśāsanike /
analyzed: ānuśāsanike
translated: In the Ānuśāsana.

original: tathāgnes tasya bhasmabhyo brahmarṣigaṇasamimtāḥ /
analyzed: tathā agneḥ tasya bhasmabhyaḥ brahmarṣi gaṇa samimtāḥ
translated: Similarly, from the ashes of that fire, the Vaikhānasa sages, who are equal to the group of Brahma-ṛṣis,

original: vaikhānasās samutpannās tapaśśrutaguṇepsavaḥ// MBh / /
analyzed: vaikhānasāḥ samutpannāḥ tapaḥ śruta guṇa īpsavaḥ
translated: arose, desiring austerities, learning, and qualities.

original: iti vaikhānasanāmnaivotpattipratipādanāt /
analyzed: iti vaikhānasa nāmnā eva utpatti pratipādanāt
translated: Thus, because it teaches the origination by the very name Vaikhānasa.

original: tathā kiṣkindhākāṇḍe /
analyzed: tathā kiṣkindhākāṇḍe
translated: Similarly, in the Kiṣkindhā-kāṇḍa.

original: śṛṅgaṃ saumanasaṃ nāma jātarūpamayaṃ dhruvam // Rā /m / /
analyzed: śṛṅgam saumanasam nāma jātarūpa mayam dhruvam
translated: The peak named Saumanasa is certainly made of gold.

original: tatra pūrvaṃ padaṃ kṛtvā purā viṣṇus trivikrame /
analyzed: tatra pūrvam padam kṛtvā purā viṣṇuḥ trivikrame
translated: There, in the past, Viṣṇu, having taken a step,

original: dvitīyaṃ śikhare raudraṃ cakāra puruṣottamaḥ // Rā /m / /🔽taduttare pratikramya jambūdvīpaṃ divākaraḥ /
analyzed: dvitīyam śikhare raudram cakāra puruṣottamaḥ  tad uttare pratikramya jambūdvīpam divākaraḥ
translated: the Supreme Being made a second step on the peak of Raudra.🔽Having stepped beyond that to the north, the sun becomes visible in the Jambu-dvīpa,

original: dṛśyo bhavati bhūyiṣṭhaṃ śikharaṃ tan mahocchrayam // Rā /m / /
analyzed: dṛśyaḥ bhavati bhūyiṣṭham śikharam tat mahā ucchrayam rām
translated: that peak is very high.

original: tatra vaikhānasā nāma vālakhilyā maharṣayaḥ /
analyzed: tatra vaikhānasāḥ nāma vālakhilyāḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: There, the great sages named Vaikhānasa, the Vālakhilya sages,

original: prakāśamānā dṛśyante sūryavarṇās tapasvinaḥ // iti Rām / /
analyzed: prakāśamānāḥ dṛśyante sūrya varṇāḥ tapasvinaḥ iti rām
translated: are seen shining, having the color of the sun, and are ascetics.

original: tatraiva catvāriṃśe 'dhyāye /
analyzed: tatra eva catvāriṃśe dhyāye
translated: In that very same forty-first chapter.

original: mainākaś ca vicetavyas sasānuprasthakandaraḥ /
analyzed: mainākaḥ ca vicetavyaḥ sa sānu prastha kandaraḥ
translated: And Mainaka, with its peaks, slopes and caves, should be searched.

original: strīṇām aśvamukhīnāñ ca niketās tatra tatra tu // Rā /m / /
analyzed: strīṇām aśvamukhīnām ca niketāḥ tatra tatra tu
translated: And here and there, the abodes of women with horse faces.

original: taṃ deśaṃ samatikramya āśramaṃ siddhasevitam /🔽siddhā vaikhānasās tatra vālakhilyāś ca tāpasāḥ // Rā /m / /
analyzed: tam deśam samatikramya āśramam siddha sevitam  siddhāḥ vaikhānasāḥ tatra vālakhilyāḥ ca tāpasāḥ rām
translated: Having crossed that region, there is an ashram frequented by the Siddhas.🔽The Siddhas, Vaikhanasas, Valakhilyas and ascetics are there.

original: vandyās te tu tapassiddhās tapasā vītakalmaṣāḥ /
analyzed: vandyāḥ te tu tapaḥsiddhāḥ tapasā vīta kalmaṣāḥ
translated: They are to be revered, those perfected in austerities, their sins destroyed by austerities.

original: praṣṭavyā cāpi sītāyāḥ pravṛttir vināyānvitaḥ // Rā /m / /
analyzed: praṣṭavyā ca api sītāyāḥ pravṛttiḥ vināyā anvitaḥ rām
translated: And they should be asked about Sita's whereabouts, free from pride.

original: hemapuṣkarasañchannaṃ tatra vaikhānasaṃ saraḥ / Rām / /
analyzed: hema puṣkara sañchannam tatra vaikhānasam saraḥ rām
translated: There is a lake of the Vaikhanasa ascetics, covered with golden lotuses.

original: iti ca vānaprasthaparatvaṃ vinā vaikhānasā vālakhilyā iti vālakhilyasamānatayā pṛthag vaṃśatvena kīrtanāt /
analyzed: iti ca vānaprastha paratvam vinā vaikhānasāḥ vālakhilyāḥ iti vālakhilya samāna tayā pṛthak vaṃśa tvena kīrtanāt
translated: Thus, the Vaikhanasas are mentioned separately as a branch, on the same level as the Valakhilyas, without being forest-dwellers, as Valakhilyas and others.

original: tathā śrīviṣṇupurāṇe dvitīṃyāṃśe navame 'dhyāye /
analyzed: tathā śrī viṣṇupurāṇe dvitīṃya aṃśe navame dhyāye
translated: Similarly, in the Vishnu Purana, in the second part, in the ninth chapter:

original: tataḥ prayāti bhagavān brāhmaṇair abhirakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas prayāti bhagavān brāhmaṇaiḥ abhirakṣitaḥ
translated: Then the Lord proceeds, protected by the Brahmanas,

original: vālakhilyādibhiś caiva prabhur vaikhānasair api // ViṣṇuP / /
analyzed: vālakhilya ādibhiḥ ca eva prabhuḥ vaikhānasaiḥ api
translated: And by the Valakhilyas and others, the Lord, and also by the Vaikhanasas.

original: mahātmābhir mahātmā vai jagatāṃ pālanodyataḥ // iti ViṣṇuP
analyzed: mahātmābhiḥ mahātmā vai jagatām pālana udyataḥ iti viṣṇup
translated: The Great Soul, the Great Soul, is engaged in protecting the worlds. Thus in the Vishnu Purana.

original: tathā sabhāparvaṇi /
analyzed: tathā sabhāparvaṇi
translated: Similarly, in the Sabhapर्व (Parvan 3):

original: pitāmahasya bhavanaṃ jagmuś ca kṛpayānvitāḥ // MBh / /
analyzed: pitāmahasya bhavanam jagmuḥ ca kṛpayā anvitāḥ
translated: And they went to the abode of the grandfather, filled with compassion.

original: tato dadṛśur ātmānaṃ saha devaiḥ pitāmaham /
analyzed: tatas dadṛśuḥ ātmānam saha devaiḥ pitāmaham
translated: Then they saw themselves with the gods and the grandfather,

original: siddhair maharṣibhiś caiva samantāt parivāritam // MBh / /
analyzed: siddhaiḥ mahā ṛṣibhiḥ ca eva samantāt parivāritam
translated: Surrounded all around by the Siddhas and the great sages.

original: tatra viṣṇur mahādevas tatrāgnir vāyunā saha /
analyzed: tatra viṣṇuḥ mahādevaḥ tatra agniḥ vāyunā saha
translated: There Vishnu, Mahadeva, Agni with Vayu,

original: candrādityau ca dharmaś ca parameṣṭhī tathā budhāḥ // MBh / /
analyzed: candra ādityau ca dharmaḥ ca parameṣṭhī tathā budhāḥ
translated: The moon, the sun, Dharma, the supreme lord, and the wise ones,

original: vaikhānasā vālakhilyās somapāś ca marīcipāḥ /
analyzed: vaikhānasāḥ vālakhilyāḥ somapāḥ ca marīcipāḥ
translated: The Vaikhanasas, the Valakhilyas, the Soma-drinkers, the Marichi-drinkers,

original: ajāś caivājamīḍhāś ca tejogarbhās tapasvinaḥ /
analyzed: ajāḥ ca eva ajamīḍhāḥ ca tejaḥ garbhāḥ tapasvinaḥ
translated: The goats, the Ajameddhas, the fiery-wombs, the ascetics,

original: ṛṣayas sarva eveti pitāmaham upāsate // MBh / /
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ sarve eva iti pitāmaham upāsate
translated: All the sages attend upon the grandfather.

original: iti ca vaikhānasānāṃ brahmasabhāpraveśavarṇanāt / tasya ca tṛtīyāśramaniṣṭheṣv asambhavāt /
analyzed: iti ca vaikhānasānām brahma sabhā praveśa varṇanāt tasya ca tṛtīya āśrama niṣṭheṣu asambhavāt
translated: Thus, because of the description of the entry of the Vaikhanasas into Brahma's assembly hall, and because that is not possible for those in the third stage of life,

original: vānaprasthānāṃ śrautakarmaniṣedhaḥ
analyzed: vānaprasthānām śrauta karma niṣedhaḥ
translated: The prohibition of Vedic rites for forest-dwellers

original: ānuśāsanike
analyzed: ānuśāsanike
translated: In the Anushasanika (Book 12, Chapter 2, Verse 1):

original: śṛṇu rājan vasiṣṭhasya mukhyaṃ karma yaśasvinaḥ / MBh / /
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan vasiṣṭhasya mukhyam karma yaśasvinaḥ
translated: Listen, O king, to the chief deed of the illustrious Vasishtha.

original: vaikhānasavidhānena gaṅgātīraṃ samāśritāḥ // MBh / / /
analyzed: vaikhānasa vidhānena gaṅgā tīram samāśritāḥ
translated: Resorting to the banks of the Ganga according to the Vaikhanasa injunctions,

original: ādityās satramīhanti saro vaikhānasaṃ prati // iti MBh / /🔽atra vānaprasthavidhau satrayāgakramavidhānābhāvāt vānaprasthāśramapraviṣṭhānāṃ
analyzed: ādityāḥ satram īhanti saraḥ vaikhānasam prati  iti  atra vānaprastha vidhau satra yāga krama vidhāna abhāvāt vānaprastha āśrama praviṣṭhānām
translated: The Adityas are performing a sacrifice in the lake of the Vaikhānasas. Thus in the Mahābhārata.🔽Here, in the rule for forest-dwellers, since there is no injunction of the sequence of sacrifices in a sacrifice,

original: tena śārīreṇa punar api devatvayogyatā 'sambhavāc ca vaikhānasavidhāneneti vaikhānasapadena
analyzed: tena śārīreṇa punar api deva tva yogyatā sambhavāt ca vaikhānasa vidhānena iti vaikhānasa padena
translated: and since it is not possible for those who have entered the stage of life of forest-dwellers to be fit again for the state of gods by that bodily [act], therefore by the rule of Vaikhānasas, by the word Vaikhānasas,

original: vānaprasthānāṃ gṛhītum aśakyatvāt /
analyzed: vānaprasthānām gṛhītum a śakya tvāt
translated: because it is not possible to include forest-dwellers,

original: kiñca śrībhāgavate ekādaśaskandhe /
analyzed: kiñca śrī bhāgavate ekādaśa skandhe
translated: and moreover, in the eleventh book of the glorious Bhāgavata,

original: vanyaiś carupuroḍāśair nirvapet kālacoditām /
analyzed: vanyaiḥ caru puroḍāśaiḥ nirvapet kāla coditām
translated: One should offer the timely oblation with wild boiled rice and cakes,

original: na tu śrautena vidhinā māṃ yajeta vanāśramī // BhāgavataP / /
analyzed: na tu śrautena vidhinā mām yajeta vana āśramī
translated: but the forest-dweller should not worship me with the injunction of the Vedas. Thus in the Bhāgavata.

original: iti vānaprasthānāṃ śarutavidhiniṣedhapratipādanāt /
analyzed: iti vānaprasthānām śaruta vidhi niṣedha pratipādanāt
translated: Because it teaches the prohibition of the injunction of the Vedas for forest-dwellers.

original: bhagavadarcanakramaḥ
translated: The sequence of worship of the Lord

original: tathā vṛddhamanau /🔽vedāntavedibhir viprais tadvaikhānasasūtribhiḥ /
analyzed: tathā vṛddhamanau  vedānta vedibhiḥ vipraiḥ tad vaikhānasa sūtribhiḥ
translated: Similarly, in the Vṛddhamāna.

original: yājayed yajñapuruṣaṃ viṣṇuṃ rājā jagaddhitaḥ // iti
analyzed: yājayet yajñapuruṣam viṣṇum rājā jagat hitaḥ iti
translated: The king, for the good of the world, should make the priest, the person of sacrifice, Viṣṇu, by the brāhmaṇas who know the Vedanta and the Vaikhānasa sūtras. Thus.

original: vaikhānasapāñcarātrikayoḥ caturmūrtiṣu saṃjñāyāṃ vaiṣamyam
analyzed: vaikhānasa pāñcarātrikayoḥ catur mūrtiṣu saṃjñāyām vaiṣamyam
translated: There is a difference in the names of the four forms of Vaikhānasa and Pāñcarātra.

original: tathā āśvamedhike /
analyzed: tathā āśvamedhike
translated: Similarly, in the Aśvamedhika.

original: yudhiṣṭhirah /
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhirah
translated: Yudhiṣṭhira.

original: kathaṃ tvaṃ arcanīyo 'si mūrtayaḥ kīdṛśāś ca te / MBh / App / /
analyzed: katham tvam arcanīyā si mūrtayaḥ kīdṛśāḥ ca te
translated: How are you to be worshipped? What are your forms like?

original: vaikhānasāḥ kathaṃ brūyuḥ kathaṃ vā pāñcarātrikāḥ // MB /h / App / /
analyzed: vaikhānasāḥ katham brūyuḥ katham vā pāñcarātrikāḥ
translated: How do the Vaikhānasas speak? Or how do the Pāñcarātrikas?

original: śrībhagavān /
translated: The Blessed Lord.

original: śṛṇu pāṇḍava tatsarvam arcanākramam ātmanaḥ / MBh / App / /
analyzed: śṛṇu pāṇḍava tat sarvam arcana kramam ātmanaḥ
translated: Listen, O son of Pandu, to all that, the procedure of worshipping Me.

original: sthaṇḍile padmakaṃ kṛtvā sāṣṭapatraṃ sakarṇikam // MB /h / App / /
analyzed: sthaṇḍile padmakam kṛtvā sa aṣṭa pattram sa karṇikam
translated: Having made a lotus with eight petals and a pericarp on the sacrificial ground,

original: aṣṭākṣaravidhānena athavā dvādaśākṣaraiḥ / MBh / App / /
analyzed: aṣṭa akṣara vidhānena athavā dvādaśa akṣaraiḥ
translated: Either with the eight-syllabled formula or with the twelve-syllabled one,

original: vaidikair athavā mantrair mama sūktena vā punaḥ // MB /h / App / /
analyzed: vaidikaiḥ athavā mantraiḥ mama sūktena vā punar
translated: Or with Vedic mantras, or again with my hymn,

original: sthitaṃ māṃ mantratas tasmin arcayet susamahitaḥ / MBh / App / /
analyzed: sthitam mām mantratas tasmin arcayet su sama hitaḥ
translated: Having placed Me there in the form of the mantra, one should worship Me with great concentration.

original: viṣṇuñ ca puruṣaṃ satyam acyutañ ca yudhiṣṭhira // MB /h / App / /
analyzed: viṣṇum ca puruṣam satyam acyutam ca yudhiṣṭhira
translated: And Vishnu, Purusha, Satya, Achyuta, O Yudhishthira,

original: aniruddhañ ca māṃ prāhur vaikhānasavido janāḥ / MBh / App / /
analyzed: aniruddham ca mām prāhuḥ vaikhānasa vidaḥ janāḥ
translated: And Aniruddha, people who know the Vaikhānasa scriptures call Me.

original: anye tv evaṃ vijānānti māṃ rājan pāñcarātrikāḥ // MB /h / App / /
analyzed: anye tu evam vijānānti mām rājan pāñcarātrikāḥ
translated: But others, O king, the Pāñcarātrikas, know Me thus,

original: vāsudevañ ca rājendra saṅkarṣaṇam athāpi vā / MBh / App / /
analyzed: vāsudevam ca rāja indra saṅkarṣaṇam atha api vā
translated: Either as Vāsudeva, O lord of kings, or as Saṅkarṣaṇa,

original: pradyumnañ cāniruddhañ ca caturmūrtiṃ pracakṣate // MBh / App / /
analyzed: pradyumnam ca aniruddham ca catur mūrtim pracakṣate
translated: Pradyumna and Aniruddha - these four forms are mentioned.

original: etāś cānyāś ca rājendra saṃjñābhedena mūrtayaḥ / MBh / App / /
analyzed: etāḥ ca anyāḥ ca rāja indra saṃjñā bhedena mūrtayaḥ
translated: And these and other forms, O king of kings, are known by different names.

original: viddhy anarthāntarā eva mām evañ cārcayed budhaḥ // iti MBh / App / /
analyzed: viddhi anartha antarāḥ eva mām evam ca arcayet budhaḥ iti
translated: And let the wise man know that they are not different from me and worship me thus.

original: tathā pāñcarātre pauṣkarasaṃhitāyām /
analyzed: tathā pāñcarātre pauṣkarasaṃhitāyām
translated: Similarly, in the Pañcarātra, in the Pauṣkara Saṃhitā,

original: viprā vaikhānasākhyā ye te bhaktās tattvam ucyate // PauṣkaraS /
analyzed: viprāḥ vaikhānasa ākhyāḥ ye te bhaktāḥ tattvam ucyate
translated: The Brahmins known as Vaikhānasas, they are devotees, their truth is being told.

original: ekantinas susattvasthā dehāntaṃ nānyayājinaḥ /
analyzed: ekantinaḥ su sattva sthāḥ dehāntam na anya yājinaḥ
translated: They are single-minded, well-established in goodness, not worshipping others until the end of the body.

original: kartavyam iti deveśaṃ saṃyajante phalaṃ vinā //
analyzed: kartavyam iti deveśam saṃyajante phalam vinā
translated: They worship the Lord of gods thinking it is their duty, without any desire for fruits.

original: iti PauṣkaraS /
analyzed: iti pauṣkaraḥ
translated: Thus says Pauṣkara.

original: śuddha / vaidika /
analyzed: śuddha vaidika
translated: Pure, Vedic,

original: tāntrikabhedena pūjātraividhyam
analyzed: tāntrika bhedena pūjā traividhyam
translated: The threefold classification of worship based on the distinction between Tantric and non-Tantric

original: tathā tatraiva tantrabhedanirṇaye /
analyzed: tathā tatra eva tantra bheda nirṇaye
translated: Similarly, in the same text, in the Tantra-bheda-nirṇaya (Determination of Tantra Divisions),

original: śuddhañ ca vaidikañ ceti tāntrikañ ca tridhā bhavet /
analyzed: śuddham ca vaidikam ca iti tāntrikam ca tridhā bhavet
translated: It is of three kinds: pure, Vedic, and Tantric.

original: pāñcarātreṇa pūjā tu śuddhaṃ viṣṇor iti smṛtam // PauṣkaraS
analyzed: pāñcarātreṇa pūjā tu śuddham viṣṇoḥ iti smṛtam
translated: The worship by the Pañcarātra is known as the pure worship of Viṣṇu.

original: vaikhānasapūjāyāḥ vaidikatvaṃ
analyzed: vaikhānasa pūjāyāḥ vaidika tvam
translated: The Vedic nature of the Vaikhānasa worship

original: vaikhānasena sūtreṇa pūjayed viṣṇum avyayam /
analyzed: vaikhānasena sūtreṇa pūjayet viṣṇum avyayam
translated: One should worship the imperishable Viṣṇu with the Vaikhānasa Sūtra.
