analyzed: tāntrika arcā vidhau ca api tāntrikaiḥ eva dīkṣitaiḥ purā tantra
translated: And in the rite of Tantric worship also, only by those initiated in the Tantra.

original: pūjanīyo hariḥ samyak vipraiḥ nānyaiḥ kadācana /
analyzed: pūjanīyaḥ hariḥ samyak vipraiḥ na anyaiḥ kadācana
translated: Hari should be worshipped properly by Brahmins, never by others.

original: anyena vidhinā mantrair anyair anyārcakena vā // Purātantra
analyzed: anyena vidhinā mantraiḥ anyaiḥ anya arcakena vā purātantra
translated: If the worship is done by another method, with other mantras, or by another worshipper,

original: ālaye tvarcanaṃ syāc cen mahādoṣo bhaved dhruvam /
analyzed: ālaye tu arcanam syāt ced mahā doṣaḥ bhavet dhruvam
translated: If there is worship in the abode, there will certainly be great fault.

original: tasmāt tu vaidike tv asminn ālayārcāvidhau dvijāḥ // Purātantra /
analyzed: tasmāt tu vaidike tu asmin ālaya arcā vidhau dvijāḥ purātantra
translated: Therefore, O Brahmins, in this Vedic rite of worshipping the abode,

original: pratiṣṭhādiṣu saṅgrāhyāḥ proktā vaikhānasā dvijāḥ /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhā ādiṣu saṅgrāhyāḥ proktāḥ vaikhānasāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: The Brahmins called Vaikhānasa are said to be to be engaged in the installation etc.

original: brahmāpi bhagavān devo harir nārāyaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ // Purātantra
analyzed: brahmā api bhagavān devaḥ hariḥ nārāyaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ purātantra
translated: The revered Brahma is also known as Hari Narayana.

original: nāviṣṇur jāyate viṣṇur nāviṣṇur viṣṇum arcayet /
analyzed: na a viṣṇuḥ jāyate viṣṇuḥ na a viṣṇuḥ viṣṇum arcayet
translated: One who is not Vishnu does not become Vishnu, one who is not Vishnu should not worship Vishnu.

original: suprītenārcakenaiva yad uktaṃ devasannidhau // Purātantra /
analyzed: su prītena arcakena eva yat uktam deva sannidhau purātantra
translated: Whatever is said by a very pleased worshipper in the presence of the deity,

original: taddevenaiva samproktaṃ tathaiva ca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat devena eva samproktam tathā eva ca bhaviṣyati
translated: That is indeed spoken by the deity itself and will come to pass accordingly.

original: arcakaṃ toṣayed viṣṇuṃ yas toṣayitum icchati // Purātantra
analyzed: arcakam toṣayet viṣṇum yaḥ toṣayitum icchati purātantra
translated: One who wishes to please Vishnu should please the worshipper.

original: tuṣṭe 'rcake jagannāthas tuṣṭha eva na saṃśayaḥ // Purātantra
analyzed: tuṣṭe rcake jagannāthaḥ tuṣṭhe eva na saṃśayaḥ purātantra
translated: When the worshipper is satisfied, the Lord of the universe is certainly satisfied.

original: svapne svarūpaṃ bhaktāya pratyakṣayati mādhavaḥ /
analyzed: svapne sva rūpam bhaktāya pratyakṣayati mādhavaḥ
translated: In a dream, Madhava reveals his own form to the devotee.

original: pravakti bhagavān viṣṇuḥ sukhaduḥkhadvayaṃ nṛṇām //
analyzed: pravakti bhagavān viṣṇuḥ sukha duḥkha dvayam nṛṇām
translated: Lord Vishnu speaks of the pair of happiness and sorrow of men.

original: iti Purātantra
analyzed: iti purātantra
translated: Thus it is in the Puratantra.

original: arcakamahimā
translated: The greatness of the worshipper

original: skānde /🔽vaikhānasīṃ mahāśākhāṃ svasūtre viniyuktavān /
analyzed: skānde  vaikhānasīm mahā śākhām sva sūtre viniyuktavān
translated: In the Skanda Purana.

original: padmabhūḥ paramo dhātā tasminn ārādhanatrayam // SkandaP
analyzed: padma bhūḥ paramaḥ dhātā tasmin ārādhana trayam skandap
translated: The Supreme Creator, born from the lotus, has employed the great branch of the Vaikhanasa school in his own sutra.🔽In it, he has spoken of the three forms of worship.

original: uktavān nigamārthānām ācāraṃ pravibhāgaśaḥ // iti SkandaP
analyzed: uktavān nigama arthānām ācāram pravibhāgaśaḥ iti skandap
translated: He has also explained the conduct and divisions of the meanings of the Vedas. Thus it is in the Skanda Purana.

original: ekasya yajurvedasya vyāsakatṛkaṃ vibhajanam
analyzed: ekasya yajurvedasya vyāsa katṛkam vibhajanam
translated: The division of the single Yajur Veda into three by Vyasa

original: brahmakaivartavacanāni pūrvam evoktāni /
analyzed: brahmakaivarta vacanāni pūrvam eva uktāni
translated: The statements of Brahma and Kaivarta have been mentioned earlier.

original: nanu ṛgyajussāmātharvāṇa iti vedānāṃ loke prasiddheḥ sarvaśākhāmūlabhūto yajurveda iti pūrvoktaṃ katham upapadyate iti ced ucyate /
analyzed: nanu ṛk yajuḥ sāma atharvāṇaḥ iti vedānām loke prasiddheḥ sarva śākhā mūla bhūtaḥ yajurvedaḥ iti pūrva uktam katham upapadyate iti ced ucyate
translated: If it is asked how it is possible to say that the Yajur Veda is the basis of all branches, when the Vedas are well-known in the world as Ṛg, Yajur, Sāma and Atharva, it is replied:

original: śrīviṣṇupurāṇe
translated: In the Viṣṇu Purāṇa:

original: vedadrumasya maitreya śākhābhedās sahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: veda drumasya maitreya śākhā bhedāḥ sahasraśas
translated: O Maitreya, the branches of the tree of the Veda are thousands in number.

original: na śakyā vistarād vaktuṃ saṅkṣepeṇa śṛṇuṣva tam // Viṣṇu /P / /
analyzed: na śakyā vistarāt vaktum saṅkṣepeṇa śṛṇuṣva tam
translated: They cannot be described in detail, listen to them in brief.

original: dvāpare dvāpare viṣṇur vyāsarūpī mahāmune // Viṣṇu /P
analyzed: dvāpare dvāpare viṣṇuḥ vyāsa rūpī mahā mune
translated: O great sage, in every Dvāpara age, Viṣṇu in the form of Vyāsa

original: vedam ekaṃ subahudhā karoti jagatāṃ hitaḥ // Viṣṇu /P / /
analyzed: vedam ekam su bahudhā karoti jagatām hitaḥ viṣṇup
translated: divides the single Veda into many for the welfare of the world.

original: vīryaṃ tejo balañ cālpaṃ manuṣyāṇām avekṣya ca /
analyzed: vīryam tejaḥ balam ca alpam manuṣyāṇām avekṣya ca
translated: Considering the limited strength, energy and power of men,

original: hitāya sarvabhūtānāṃ vedabhedaṃ karoti saḥ // Viṣṇu /P / /
analyzed: hitāya sarva bhūtānām veda bhedam karoti saḥ viṣṇup
translated: he divides the Veda for the benefit of all beings.

original: ity ārabhya🔽eka āsīd yajurvedas taṃ caturdhā hy akalpayat /
analyzed: iti ārabhya  ekaḥ āsīt yajurvedaḥ tam caturdhā hi akalpayat
translated: Beginning from here,🔽there was one Yajur Veda, which he divided into four parts.

original: cāturhotram abhūd yasmiṃs tena yajñam athākarot // Viṣṇu /P / /
analyzed: cāturhotram abhūt yasmin tena yajñam atha akarot viṣṇup
translated: In which the fourfold priesthood arose, by that he performed the sacrifice.

original: ārdhvaryavaṃ yajurbhis tu ṛgbhir hautraṃ tathā muniḥ /
analyzed: ārdhvaryavam yajurbhiḥ tu ṛgbhiḥ hautram tathā muniḥ
translated: The sage performed the Adhvaryu duties with the Yajur mantras, and the Hotra duties with the Ṛg mantras.

original: audgātraṃ sāmabhiś cakre brahmatvañ cāpy atharvabhiḥ // Viṣṇu /P / /
analyzed: audgātram sāmabhiḥ cakre brahmatvam ca api atharvabhiḥ
translated: He made the Udgātṛ position with the Sāman verses and the Brahman position with the Atharvan verses.

original: tatas sa ṛca uddhṛtya ṛgvedaṃ kṛtavān muniḥ /
analyzed: tatas saḥ ṛcaḥ uddhṛtya ṛgvedam kṛtavān muniḥ
translated: Then, extracting the Ṛc verses, the sage created the Ṛg Veda.

original: yajurbhiś ca yajurvedaṃ sāmavedañ ca sāmābhiḥ // Viṣṇu /P / /
analyzed: yajurbhiḥ ca yajurvedam sāmavedam ca sāmābhiḥ
translated: With the Yajuḥ verses, he created the Yajur Veda, and with the Sāman verses, the Sāman Veda.

original: rājñāntvatharvavedena sarvakarmāṇi sa prabhuḥ /
analyzed: rājñā antu atharvavedena sarva karmāṇi sa prabhuḥ
translated: With the Atharva Veda, that Lord performed all the rites,

original: kārayāmāsa maitreya brahmatvañ ca yathāsthiti /// ViṣṇuP / /🔽so 'yam eko mahān vedatarus tena pṛthakkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kārayāmāsa maitreya brahmatvam ca yathāsthiti  saḥ yam ekaḥ mahān veda taruḥ tena pṛthakkṛtaḥ
translated: and the Brahman position, O Maitreya, as it was before.🔽Thus, by him, that one great tree of the Veda was divided into four.

original: caturdhā ca tato jātaṃ vedapādapakānanam // ViṣṇuP / /
analyzed: caturdhā ca tatas jātam veda pādapa kānanam
translated: And from that, the forest of the Veda trees was born.

original: ity antena spaṣṭaṃ pratipāditatvāt yajurveda eka eva prathamāsītity avagamyate /
analyzed: iti antena spaṣṭam pratipādita tvāt yajurvedaḥ ekaḥ eva prathamā āsīt iti avagamyate
translated: Thus, it is clearly stated up to this point, and it is understood that the Yajur Veda alone existed first.

original: yajurvedasya vaikhānasaśākhātvaprasiddhiḥ
analyzed: yajurvedasya vaikhānasa śākhā tva prasiddhiḥ
translated: The fame of the Yajur Veda as the Vaikhānasa branch

original: sa ca yajurvedaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca yajurvedaḥ
translated: And that Yajur Veda,

original: bahuśṛṅgaś catus sānuḥ pṛthulo vedaparvataḥ ity ārabhyoktarītyā vedavyāsarupiṇā bhagavatā yadā vyastaḥ /
analyzed: bahu śṛṅgaḥ catuḥ sānuḥ pṛthulaḥ vedaparvataḥ iti ārabhya ukta rītyā vedavyāsa rupiṇā bhagavatā yadā vyastaḥ
translated: which is said to be the Veda mountain with many peaks, four plateaus, and wide sides, when divided by the Lord in the form of Veda Vyāsa, beginning with this,

original: tataḥ pūrvam ekarūpeṇāvasthitasya tasya vedaparvatasya vaikhānasaśākhātvaprasiddhir āsīd iti pūrvam eva pratipāditam /
analyzed: tatas pūrvam eka rūpeṇa avasthitasya tasya vedaparvatasya vaikhānasa śākhā tva prasiddhiḥ āsīt iti pūrvam eva pratipāditam
translated: Then, it has been previously established that before that, that Veda-Parva was known as belonging to the Vaikhānasa branch, while existing in one form.

original: vaikhānasānāṃ śraiṣṭhyam
analyzed: vaikhānasānām śraiṣṭhyam
translated: The supremacy of the Vaikhānasa

original: vaikhānasānāṃ śreṣṭhyaṃ pañcakālaparāyaṇatvañ ca
analyzed: vaikhānasānām śreṣṭhyam pañca kāla parāyaṇa tvam ca
translated: The supremacy of the Vaikhānasa and being devoted to the five-time worship

original: prasaṅgāt vaikhānasaśākhāmūlakatvena praṇītasūtrānuṣṭhātṝṇāṃ śreṣṭhatvam acchidrapañcakālaparāyaṇatvādikañ ca pratipādyate /
analyzed: prasaṅgāt vaikhānasa śākhā mūlaka tvena praṇīta sūtra anuṣṭhātṝṇām śreṣṭha tvam acchidra pañcakāla parāyaṇa tva ādikam ca pratipādyate
translated: Incidentally, it is taught that the followers of the sutras composed based on the Vaikhānasa branch are supreme due to being devoted to the five-time worship without fault, etc.

original: yathā sāmabrahmaṇe /
analyzed: yathā sāmabrahmaṇe
translated: As in the Sāma Veda Brāhmaṇa.

original: vaikhānasā vā ṛṣaya indrasya priyā āsan iti ChāndogyaBr / /
analyzed: vaikhānasāḥ vai ṛṣayaḥ indrasya priyāḥ āsan iti chāndogya brāhmaṇam
translated: The Vaikhānasa sages were dear to Indra. Thus in the Chāndogya Brāhmaṇa.

original: vaikhānasānāṃ bhagavatpriyatamatvam
analyzed: vaikhānasānām bhagavat priyatama tvam
translated: The Vaikhānasa are the most beloved of the Lord

original: vārāhe /
analyzed: vārāhe
translated: In the Varāha Purāṇa.

original: aśvatthaḥ kapilā gāvas tulasī vikhanās tathā /
analyzed: aśvatthaḥ kapilāḥ gāvaḥ tulasī vikhanāḥ tathā
translated: The holy fig tree, the tawny cows, Tulasī, and the Vaikhānasa,

original: catvāro matpriyā rājaṃs teṣāṃ vaikhānaso varaḥ // iti VarāhaP
analyzed: catvāraḥ mad priyāḥ rājan teṣām vaikhānasaḥ varaḥ iti varāhap
translated: O king, these four are dear to me, among them the Vaikhānasa is the best. Thus in the Varāha Purāṇa.

original: vaikhānasadarśanaphalam
analyzed: vaikhānasa darśana phalam
translated: The fruit of seeing the Vaikhānasa

original: vṛddhayājñavalkye /🔽vaikhānaso vaidikeṣu brahmanirdiṣṭam ācaret /
analyzed: vṛddhayājñavalkye  vaikhānasaḥ vaidikeṣu brahma nirdiṣṭam ācaret
translated: In the Vṛddha-Yājñavalkya.🔽The Vaikhānasa should perform what is prescribed by Brahmā among the Vedic ones.

original: taṃ brāhmaṇan tu dṛṣṭvaiva sarvaṃ pāpaṃ vyapohati //
analyzed: tam brāhmaṇan tu dṛṣṭvā eva sarvam pāpam vyapohati
translated: Merely by seeing that Brāhmaṇa, all sin is removed.

original: Vṛddhayājñavalkya /
analyzed: vṛddha yājñavalkya
translated: O Vṛddhayajñavalkya.

original: vaiṣṇavīṃ pratimāṃ loke vipraṃ vaikhānasaṃ tathā /
analyzed: vaiṣṇavīm pratimām loke vipram vaikhānasam tathā
translated: One who sees the image of Viṣṇu in the world, a Brāhmaṇa who is a Vaikhānasa,

original: gaṅgāṃ viṣṇupadīṃ dṛṣṭvā sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate //
analyzed: gaṅgām viṣṇupadīm dṛṣṭvā sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate

analyzed: puruṣam ca tatas satyam acyutam ca yudhiṣṭhira
translated: And from that, O Yudhiṣṭhira, they call me Puruṣa, Satya, Acyuta,

original: aniruddhañ ca māṃ prāhur vaikhānasavido janāḥ // MBh / App / /
analyzed: aniruddham ca mām prāhuḥ vaikhānasa vidaḥ janāḥ
translated: And Aniruddha, the people who know the Vaikhānasas.

original: anye tv evaṃ vijānanti māṃ rājan pāñcarātrikāḥ / MBh / App / /
analyzed: anye tu evam vijānanti mām rājan pāñcarātrikāḥ
translated: But others, O king, who belong to the Pāñcarātra sect, know me thus.

original: vāsudevañ ca rājendra saṅkarṣaṇam athāpi vā // MBh / App / /
analyzed: vāsudevam ca rāja indra saṅkarṣaṇam atha api vā
translated: And Vāsudeva, O lord of kings, and Saṅkarṣaṇa,

original: pradyumnañ cāniruddhañ ca caturmūrtiṃ pracakṣate / MBh / App / /
analyzed: pradyumnam ca aniruddham ca catur mūrtim pracakṣate
translated: And Pradyumna and Aniruddha, they declare the four forms.

original: etāś cānyāś ca rājendra saṃjñābhedena mūrtayaḥ // MBh / App / /
analyzed: etāḥ ca anyāḥ ca rāja indra saṃjñā bhedena mūrtayaḥ
translated: And these and other forms, O lord of kings, by different names,

original: viddhi me 'rcāntarāṇy eva mām evañ cārcayed budhaḥ // MBh / App / /
analyzed: viddhi me rcā antarāṇi eva mām evam ca arcayet budhaḥ
translated: Know them to be my other forms, and thus should the wise one worship me.

original: ityādy uktānāṃ caturṇāṃ vyūhānāṃ vibhāgāvit /
analyzed: ityādi uktānām caturṇām vyūhānām vibhāga vid
translated: Thus it is said. And one who knows the division of the four vyūhas that are mentioned,

original: vāsudevasya daivikamānuṣabhedena dvaividhyam
analyzed: vāsudevasya daivika mānuṣa bhedena dvaividhyam
translated: Vāsudeva has two forms, divine and human.

original: evaṃ vaikhānase daivikamānuṣabhedena vāsudevo dvividhaḥ pratipādyate / yathā
analyzed: evam vaikhānase daivika mānuṣa bhedena vāsudevaḥ dvividhaḥ pratipādyate yathā
translated: Thus, in the Vaikhānasa [Upaniṣad], Vāsudeva is taught to be of two kinds, divided into divine and human, as follows:🔽In the Khilas. Then, after that, the supreme ritual of the human Vāsudeva,

original: khile / athordhvaṃ vāsudevasya mānuṣasya vidhiṃ paraṃ / ity ārabhya mānuṣyavapuṣaṃ
analyzed: khile atha ūrdhvam vāsudevasya mānuṣasya vidhim param iti ārabhya mānuṣya vapuṣam
translated: beginning with The god with a human form,

original: devaṃ dvibhujaṃ śaṅkhacakriṇam ityādinā rukmiṇīpradyumnāniruddhasāmbabrahmagaruḍādiyutaṃ
analyzed: devam dvi bhujam śaṅkha cakriṇam ityādinā rukmiṇī pradyumnā aniruddha sāmba brahma garuḍa ādi yutam
translated: having two arms, holding a conch and discus, and so on, accompanied by Rukmiṇī, Pradyumna, Aniruddha, Sāmba, Brahmā, Garuḍa, and others,

original: mānuṣavāsudevaṃ nirvarṇya punaḥ /
analyzed: mānuṣa vāsudevam nirvarṇya punar
translated: having described the human Vāsudeva, he again says:

original: daivikaṃ vāsudevaṃ taṃ pravakṣyāmy ānupūrvyaśaḥ /
analyzed: daivikam vāsudevam tam pravakṣyāmi ānupūrvyaśaḥ
translated: I shall describe that divine Vāsudeva in due order.

original: somacchandavimānaṃ vā bṛhadvṛttam athāpi vā //
analyzed: somacchanda vimānam vā bṛhat vṛttam atha api vā
translated: Either the Soma-meter chariot, or the large circle,

original: caturbhujadharaṃ devaṃ śaṅkhacakradharaṃ param /
analyzed: catur bhuja dharam devam śaṅkha cakra dharam param
translated: The god with four arms, the supreme holder of conch and discus,

original: abhayaṃ dakṣiṇaṃ hastaṃ vāmaṃ kaṭyavalambitam //
analyzed: abhayam dakṣiṇam hastam vāmam kaṭi avalambitam
translated: The right hand is fearless, the left hand rests on the hip,

original: kirīṭādisamastaiś ca bhūṣaṇair api bhūṣitam /
analyzed: kirīṭa ādi samastaiḥ ca bhūṣaṇaiḥ api bhūṣitam
translated: And he is adorned with all ornaments such as a crown,

original: raktāmbaradharaṃ devaṃ daśātālena mānataḥ //
analyzed: rakta ambara dharam devam daśa tālena mānataḥ
translated: The god wearing red garments, with a height of ten cubits,

original: ubhe devyāv ubhe pārśve pūrvavat kārayed budhaḥ /
analyzed: ubhe devyau ubhe pārśve pūrvavat kārayet budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should make both goddesses on both sides as before.

original: balabhadrādipūrvoktaṃ sāyudhaṃ vā nirāyudham //
analyzed: balabhadra ādi pūrva uktam sa āyudham vā nirāyudham
translated: Either with weapons or without weapons, beginning with Balabhadra and the previously mentioned,

original: tattad devībis hier tnoch telugu vergleichensamāyuktaṃ vinā vā samyag ācaret /
analyzed: tat tat hier tnoch telugu verglichen samāyuktam vinā vā samyak ācaret
translated: One should perform it properly, either with or without those and those goddesses.

original: revatī rohiṇī caiva ramācendukarīti ca //
analyzed: revatī rohiṇī ca eva ramācā indukarī iti ca
translated: Revati, Rohini, Rama, and Chandrakari,

original: raktaṃ nīlaṃ tathā śyāmaṃ pītavarṇaṃ samācaret /
analyzed: raktam nīlam tathā śyāmam pīta varṇam samācaret
translated: One should perform it with red, blue, dark, and yellow colors.

original: kirīṭamakuṭādyuktās sarvābharaṇabhūṣitāḥ //
analyzed: kirīṭa makuṭa ādi uktāḥ sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitāḥ
translated: Adorned with crowns, diadems, and so on, and all ornaments,

original: evaṃ puṣpadharaṃ kuryād ekañ caiva prasāritam /
analyzed: evam puṣpa dharam kuryāt ekam ca eva prasāritam
translated: One should make the flower-holder like this, and also one extended.

original: devyā yuktaṃ vinā vāpi dvimārgaṃ samyag ācaret //
analyzed: devyā yuktam vinā vā api dvi mārgam samyak ācaret
translated: One should perform the two paths properly, either with or without the goddess.

original: ity ārabhya evaṃ daivikamārgan tu sthāpanārambham ācared ityādinā daivikaḥ vāsudevaḥ pradarśitaḥ /
analyzed: iti ārabhya evam daivika mārgan tu sthāpana ārambham ācaret ityādinā daivikaḥ vāsudevaḥ pradarśitaḥ
translated: Beginning with this, up to Thus one should perform the installation beginning with the divine path, the divine Vāsudeva is shown.

original: vaikhānasetarasūtriṇāṃ pañcakālaparāyaṇatvābhavāḥ
analyzed: vaikhānasa itara sūtriṇām pañca kāla parāyaṇa tva ābhavāḥ
translated: Those who follow the other Sūtras of the Vaikhānasa do not have the five-time devotion.

original: itthaṃ vāsudevādīnāṃ daivikamānuṣabhedena dvaividhyasya /
analyzed: ittham vāsudeva ādīnām daivika mānuṣa bhedena dvaividhyasya
translated: Thus, the twofold division of Vāsudeva and others into divine and human,

original: puruṣaṃ paramapuruṣaṃ paramātmānaṃ paraṃ brahmāṇam ityādinā pratipāditānāṃ caturṇāṃ puruṣādīnāṃ mūrtivibhāgasya ca śrīvaikhānasaśāstre pratipādanāt /
analyzed: puruṣam paramapuruṣam paramātmānam param brahmāṇam ityādinā pratipāditānām caturṇām puruṣa ādīnām mūrti vibhāgasya ca śrī vaikhānasa śāstre pratipādanāt
translated: And the division of the four forms of Puruṣa and others, which are taught as Puruṣa, the Supreme Person, the Supreme Self, the Supreme Brahman, and so on, is taught in the Śrī Vaikhānasa scriptures.

original: etas sarvavibhāgajña eva caturvyūhavibhāgavid ity anenocyate / ācchidrapañcakālajña iti /
analyzed: sarva vibhāga jñaḥ eva catur vyūha vibhāga vid iti anena ucyate ācchidra pañca kāla jñaḥ iti
translated: And by this, it is said that he who knows all these divisions is indeed the knower of the division of the four vyūhas. He who knows the five times without omission.

original: prātaḥkāle 'bhigamanam upādānaṃ tataḥ param /
analyzed: prātar kāle bhigamanam upādānam tatas param
translated: Approaching in the morning, accepting after that,

original: madhyāhna ijyāṃ kurvīta svādhyāyañ cāparāhṇake /🔽yogaṃ sāyāhnakāle tu pañcakālā udāhṛtāḥ // VA
analyzed: madhyāhne ijyām kurvīta svādhyāyam ca aparāhṇake  yogam sāyāhna kāle tu pañca kālāḥ udāhṛtāḥ
translated: In the midday he should perform the worship, and in the afternoon the recitation of the Veda,🔽Yoga in the evening - these are said to be the five times.

original: iti vāsādhikāre pratipāditapañcakālaparāyaṇam adhikṛtya prakṛttāni
analyzed: iti vāsa adhikāre pratipādita pañca kāla parāyaṇam adhikṛtya prakṛttāni
translated: With reference to one who is devoted to the five times as taught in the section on Vāsa, the following statements are made:

original: ye pāvayanti dharaṇīṃ ijyāmadhye tathāhome ye toṣayanty avirataṃ iti vacanāni /
analyzed: ye pāvayanti dharaṇīm ijyā madhye tathā home ye toṣayanti aviratam iti vacanāni
translated: Those who purify the earth in the midst of worship and likewise in the fire offering, those who constantly satisfy - these statements.

original: sāmanyena pañcakālaparāyaṇasya darśanasparśanādibhis sarveṣāṃ pāvanatāṃ kṛtārthatāṃ /
analyzed: sāmanyena pañca kāla parāyaṇasya darśana sparśana ādibhiḥ sarveṣām pāvana tām kṛtārtha tām
translated: In general, they teach that by seeing, touching, etc., of one who is devoted to the five times, all are purified and made content.

original: ijyāyogādisamayeṣu cāgatasya tasya pūjanāntaraṃ śeṣakarmācaraṇañ ca pratipādayanti /
analyzed: ijyā yoga ādi samayeṣu ca āgatasya tasya pūjana antaram śeṣa karma ācaraṇam ca pratipādayanti
translated: And at the times of worship, yoga, etc., they teach that after worshipping him who has come, one should perform the remaining duties.

original: etādṛśaḥ pañcakālaparāyaṇaḥ kīdṛśā ity ākaṅkṣāyāṃ dvādaśākṣaratattvajña ityādinā acchidrapañcakālajña ity antena tallakṣaṇam ucyate /
analyzed: etādṛśaḥ pañca kāla parāyaṇaḥ kīdṛśāḥ iti ākaṅkṣāyām dvādaśa akṣara tattva jñaḥ ityādinā acchidra pañca kāla jñaḥ iti antena tad lakṣaṇam ucyate
translated: When there is a desire to know what kind of person is devoted to the five times, his definition is stated from knowing the truth of the twelve-syllable mantra up to knowing the five times without omission.

original: īdṛśācchidrapañcakālaparāyaṇā vaikhānasā eva / vaikhānasaśāstra eva pañcakālavibhāgasya
analyzed: īdṛśa acchidra pañca kāla parāyaṇāḥ vaikhānasāḥ eva vaikhānasa śāstre eva pañca kāla vibhāgasya
translated: The Vaikhānasas are those who are devoted to the five daily periods of worship with such breaks. In the Vaikhānasa scriptures alone, the division of the five daily periods of worship is clearly stated.

original: pratipāditatvāt / svasvasūtre 'nuktatvād āpastambīyādayas tu na / pañcakālapratipādanarahitasūtrāntaraniṣṭhānāṃ /
analyzed: pratipādita tvāt sva sva sūtre n ukta tvāt āpastambīya ādayaḥ tu na pañca kāla pratipādana rahita sūtra antara niṣṭhānām
translated: The Vaikhānasas alone are devoted to the five-time worship with such a gap, because the division of the five times is taught only in the Vaikhānasa scriptures. But the Āpastambīyas and others are not, because they are devoted to other scriptures that do not teach the five times.

original: brāhme muhūrte buddhyeta dharmārthāv anucintayan /
analyzed: brāhme muhūrte buddhyeta dharma arthau anucintayan
translated: In the Brahma muhurta, one should think and reflect on dharma and artha.

original: ity ārabhya
analyzed: iti ārabhya
translated: Beginning with this,

original: dvitīye ca tathā bhāge vedābhyāso vidhīyate //
analyzed: dvitīye ca tathā bhāge veda abhyāsaḥ vidhīyate
translated: and in the second part, the study of the Vedas is prescribed.

original: tṛtīye ca tathā bhāge poṣyavargārthacintanam /
analyzed: tṛtīye ca tathā bhāge poṣya varga artha cintanam
translated: And in the third part, one should think about the welfare of one's dependents.

original: bhāge caturthe kurvīta snānam ambhasy akṛtrime //
analyzed: bhāge caturthe kurvīta snānam ambhasi akṛtrime
translated: In the fourth part, one should perform ablutions in natural water.

original: pañcame tu tathā bhāge saṃvibhāgo yathārhataḥ /
analyzed: pañcame tu tathā bhāge saṃvibhāgaḥ yathārhataḥ
translated: But in the fifth part, one should distribute [wealth] as appropriate.

original: itihāsapurāṇābhyāṃ ṣaṣṭaṃ saptamam abhyaset /
analyzed: itihāsa purāṇābhyām ṣaṣṭam saptamam abhyaset
translated: In the sixth and seventh parts, one should study history and the Puranas.

original: aṣṭame lokayātrāñ ca vicārya ca gṛhī tataḥ //
analyzed: aṣṭame lokayātrām ca vicārya ca gṛhī tatas
translated: And in the eighth, the householder should consider the affairs of the world and then

original: ity antena dakṣādismṛtyantareṣu brāhmaṇajāteḥ sāmānyena tattatkāleṣu kartavyatvena pratipāditakarmācaraṇa eva yathāyogyaṃ yogyatāsambhavāt /
analyzed: iti antena dakṣa ādi smṛti antareṣu brāhmaṇa jāteḥ sāmānyena tad tad kāleṣu kartavya tvena pratipādita karma ācaraṇaḥ eva yathāyogyam yogyatā sambhavāt
translated: Because the performance of duties taught in other Smritis like those of Daksha etc. as to be done in those respective times in general for the Brahmana caste is possible only by one who is qualified as per his capacity.

original: anyathā
analyzed: anyathā
translated: Otherwise,

original: vidharmaḥ paradharmaś ca ābhāsa upa vā cchalaḥ /
analyzed: vidharmaḥ para dharmaḥ ca ābhāsaḥ upa vā chalaḥ
translated: Adharma, paradharma, ābhāsa, upācchara,

original: adharmaśākhāḥ pañcemā dharmajño 'dharmavattyajet //🔽dharmabādho vidharmas syāt paradharmo 'nyacoditaḥ /
analyzed: adharma śākhāḥ pañca imāḥ dharma jñaḥ dharmavat tyajet  dharma bādhaḥ vidharmaḥ syāt para dharmaḥ
translated: these five branches of adharma, a knower of dharma should abandon like adharma.🔽Adharma would be the obstruction of dharma, paradharma would be enjoined by another,

original: upadharmas tu pāṣaṇḍo dambhovāṃśasurbhiśchalaḥ / /
analyzed: upadharmaḥ tu pāṣaṇḍaḥ
translated: but upadharma is heresy, hypocrisy, and deceit.

original: yas tv icchayā kṛtaṃ pumbhir ābhāso hy āśramād bahiḥ // /
analyzed: yaḥ tu icchayā kṛtam pumbhiḥ ābhāsaḥ hi āśramāt bahis
translated: But ābhāsa is done by men out of desire, outside the āśramas.

original: iti bhāgavatavacanoktaparadharmāśrayaṇadoṣaprasaṅgaḥ /🔽śreyān svadharmo viguṇaḥ paradharmāt svanuṣṭhitāt /
analyzed: iti bhāgavata vacana ukta para dharma āśrayaṇa doṣa prasaṅgaḥ  śreyān svadharmaḥ viguṇaḥ para dharmāt su anuṣṭhitāt
translated: Thus there is the undesirable consequence of resorting to paradharma as stated in the words of the Bhagavata.🔽Better is one's own dharma, though defective, than another's well-performed dharma.

original: svadharme nidhanaṃ śreyaḥ paradharmo bhayāvahaḥ // MBh / /
analyzed: svadharme nidhanam śreyaḥ para dharmaḥ bhaya āvahaḥ
translated: Death in one's own dharma is better, another's dharma is fearful.

original: iti bhagavadvacanavirodhaś ca /
analyzed: iti bhagavat vacana virodhaḥ ca
translated: And there is contradiction with the words of the Lord.

original: sūtrāntaranuṣṭhānāṃ pāñcarātrānuyāyināñ ca devalakatvam
analyzed: sūtra anta ranuṣṭhānām pāñcarātra anuyāyinām ca devalaka tvam
translated: And those who follow the Pāñcarātra system, who practice other sūtras, are Devala-s.

original: kiñca tatsūtreṣu dvādaśākṣaratattvādipratipādanam api nāsti / evaṃ sati
analyzed: kiñca tad sūtreṣu dvādaśa akṣara tattva ādi pratipādanam api na asti evam sati
translated: Moreover, the teaching of the truth of the twelve-syllable mantra etc. is not even found in those sūtras. In such a case,

original: kuḍye citrakarmeti nyāyena yajñopavītadhāraṇasandhyopāsanabhagavadārādhanādividhipratipādanarahitasūtrāntaraniṣṭhānāṃ /
analyzed: kuḍye citra karmā iti nyāyena yajñopavīta dhāraṇa sandhyā upāsana bhagavat ārādhana ādi vidhi pratipādana rahita sūtra antara niṣṭhānām
translated: like the saying painting on a wall, those who follow sūtras that do not teach the injunctions of wearing the sacred thread, worshipping the sun, and worshipping the Lord etc.,

original: tathā śrīmannārāyaṇasya samānatvena rudrādidevatāntarārādhanavidhipratipādakasūtraniṣṭhānāñ
analyzed: tathā śrīmat nārāyaṇasya samāna tvena rudra ādi devatā antara ārādhana vidhi pratipādaka sūtra niṣṭhānāt
translated: Similarly, due to the equality of the glorious Nārāyaṇa, and the impossibility of knowing the division of the four vyūhas,

original: ca caturvyūhavibhāgajñānāsambhavāt bhagavadārādhanasvarūpajñānābhāvena pañcakālaparāyaṇatvādigandhaleśo🔽'pi na sambhavati / sūtrāntaroktamārgeṇa vā pañcarātroktamārgeṇa vā bhagavadārādhanaṃ
analyzed: ca catur vyūha vibhāga jñāna asambhavāt bhagavat ārādhana sva rūpa jñāna abhāvena pañca kāla parāyaṇa tva ādi gandha leśaḥ  na sambhavati sūtra antara ukta mārgeṇa vā pañcarātra ukta mārgeṇa vā bhagavat ārādhanam
translated: due to the absence of knowledge of the nature of worshipping the Lord, even the slightest trace of being devoted to the five-time worship is not possible.

original: kurvato 'nadhikāriṇo devalakatvaṃ pratipādyate /
analyzed: kurvataḥ na adhikāriṇaḥ devalaka tvam pratipādyate
translated: Or, it is taught that one who does not have the right to worship the Lord by the path stated in other sūtras or by the path stated in the Pañcarātra, is a devalaka.

original: pāñcarātre durgādidevatāntarārcanapratipādanam
translated: Teaching of the worship of other deities like Durgā in the Pañcarātra

original: tathā hi pañcarātre viṣvaksenasaṃhitāyāṃ nāradaṃ prati viṣvaksenoktiḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi pañcarātre viṣvaksenasaṃhitāyām nāradam prati viṣvaksena uktiḥ
translated: Thus, in the Pañcarātra, in the Viṣṇu Saṃhitā, Viṣvaksena says to Nārada:

original: idan tu tava vakṣyāmi guhyād guhyatamaṃ mune /🔽yo 'sau nārayaṇas sākṣāt sa hi vighneśa ucyate // ViṣvaksenaS /
analyzed: idam tu tava vakṣyāmi guhyāt guhyatamam mune  yaḥ sau nārayaṇaḥ sākṣāt sa hi vighneśaḥ ucyate viṣvaksenaḥ
translated: But this I will tell you, O sage, which is more secret than secret.🔽He who is Nārāyaṇa himself is said to be Gaṇeśa. Viṣvaksena.

original: yo vai vighneśa ity uktas sa vai nārāyaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai vighneśaḥ iti uktaḥ sa vai nārāyaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: He who is said to be Gaṇeśa is remembered as Nārāyaṇa.

original: Viṣvaksena /S /
analyzed: viṣvaksenaḥ
translated: Viṣvaksena.

original: naiva bhedaṃ vijānanti munayas tattvadarśinaḥ //
analyzed: na eva bhedam vijānanti munayaḥ tattva darśinaḥ
translated: The sages who see the truth do not know any difference.

original: ity ārabhya ViṣvaksenaS /
analyzed: iti ārabhya viṣvaksenaḥ
translated: Beginning thus, Viṣvaksena.

original: kuryāt pāśāṅkuśau vāpi śaṅkhacakrāv athāpi vā /
analyzed: kuryāt pāśa aṅkuśau vā api śaṅkha cakrau atha api vā
translated: One should make the noose and goad, or else the conch and discus,

original: ākhuṃ vāpi khagendraṃ vā tasya vāhanam ācaret // ViṣvaksenaS
analyzed: ākhum vā api khaga indram vā tasya vāhanam ācaret
translated: Or else one should make the rat or the king of birds his vehicle.

original: nārāyaṇāśakatvāc cāvyāvṛttatvān mahāmune /
analyzed: nārāyaṇa aśaka tvāt ca a vyāvṛtta tvāt mahā mune
translated: O great sage, because of being Narayana's form and not being excluded,

original: vīśas tadvāhanaṃ proktaṃ ākhuṃ vāpi samācaret // Viṣvaksena /S
analyzed: vīśaḥ tat vāhanam proktam ākhum vā api samācaret
translated: The rat is said to be its vehicle, or one should make it a rat.

original: tasmāc chriyañ ca durgāñ ca vāṇīṃ vighneśam eva ca /

translated: There is no doubt that in one year, there is the fruit of living in the same world.

original: PādmaS caryāpāda /
analyzed: pādmaḥ caryā pāda
translated: The Padma Purana, in the chapter on conduct,

original: iti pādme caryāpāde trayodaśe 'dhyāye avicchinnatayā pañcakālānāṃ pratipāditatvāt teṣām apy acchidrapañcakālaparāyaṇatvaṃ sambhavatīti
analyzed: iti pādme caryā pāde trayodaśe dhyāye avicchinna tayā pañca kālānām pratipādita tvāt teṣām api acchidra pañca kāla parāyaṇa tvam sambhavati iti
translated: Thus, in the thirteenth chapter of the Padma Purana on conduct, the five times are taught without interruption, so it is possible for them also to be devoted to the five times without a break.

original: cet tad asat /
analyzed: ced tat asat
translated: If so, that is not so.

original: pāñcarātriṇām aniyataparimitacchidradrapañcakālaparāyaṇatvam
analyzed: pāñcarātriṇām aniyata parimita chidra dra pañca kāla parāyaṇa tvam
translated: The Pancharatrikas are devoted to the five times with a limited number of breaks.

original: tatraiva /
analyzed: tatra eva
translated: In the same text,

original: pūtyūṣam ardharātrañ ca prātar madhyaṃdināni ca /
analyzed: pūtyūṣam ardharātram ca prātar madhyaṃdināni ca
translated: The dawn, midnight, morning, and midday,

original: pañcakālā ime proktās tataḥ kālacatuṣṭaye //
analyzed: pañca kālāḥ ime proktāḥ tatas kāla catuṣṭaye
translated: These five times are mentioned, and then in the four times,

original: eteṣu hīnāḥ pratyūṣaṃ /
analyzed: eteṣu hīnāḥ pratyūṣam
translated: In these, the dawn is deficient,

original: vijñeyāś caturānana //
analyzed: vijñeyāḥ caturānana
translated: And should be known, four-faced.

original: ity abhigamanādīnām ekarūpeṇa vinā nyūnātiriktakālatvenoktatvāt kālaṃ
analyzed: iti abhigamana ādīnām eka rūpeṇa vinā nyūna atirikta kāla tvena ukta tvāt kālam
translated: Thus, because visiting and so on are mentioned as being deficient or excessive in time without a single form, the time

original: madhyandinacchidrapañcakālaparāyaṇair ity āgamasiddhānte sāntarālam anuṣṭhānaṃ
analyzed: madhyandina chidra pañca kāla parāyaṇaiḥ iti āgama siddhānte sa antarālam anuṣṭhānam
translated: is to be known by those devoted to the five times with a break at midday, according to the established conclusion of the scriptures. The practice with intervals is

original: pañcakāloditaṃ tathā iti tantrasiddhānte ca chidrapañcakālaparatvasyoktatvāt /
analyzed: pañca kāla uditam tathā iti tantrasiddhānte ca chidra pañca kāla para tvasya ukta tvāt
translated: And the five times have been declared in the Tantra Siddhānta, because it has been said that it refers to the five times with gaps.

original: kālacatuṣṭayapratipādanena niyatapañcakālaparāyaṇatvābhāvāt /
translated: Because by teaching the four times, there is no complete adherence to the five times.

original: dvādaśavarṣam ārabhya ekavarṣaparyantaṃ parimitapañcakālaparatvasyoktatvāt dvādaśavarṣād ūrdhvaṃ pañcakālaparatvābhāvāc ca /
analyzed: dvādaśa varṣam ārabhya eka varṣa paryantam parimita pañca kāla para tvasya ukta tvāt dvādaśa varṣāt ūrdhvam pañca kāla para tva abhāvāt ca
translated: Because it has been said that from twelve years up to one year, it refers to the limited five times, and because there is no adherence to the five times after twelve years.

original: tathā / mārkaṇḍeye
analyzed: tathā mārkaṇḍeye
translated: Similarly, in the Mārkaṇḍeya Purāṇa:

original: mahāniśā tu vijñeyā rātrer madhyaṃ dvitīyayoḥ /
analyzed: mahāniśā tu vijñeyā rātreḥ madhyam dvitīyayoḥ
translated: The middle of the night should be known as the second half of the night.

original: tasyāṃ snānaṃ na kurvīta samyag ācamanaṃ tathā // MarkaṇḍeyaP
analyzed: tasyām snānam na kurvīta samyak ācamanam tathā
translated: One should not bathe then, nor perform proper Ācamana.

original: ity ācamanasya mahāniśāyāṃ niṣedhāt /
analyzed: iti ācamanasya mahāniśāyām niṣedhāt
translated: Thus, because Ācamana is prohibited in the middle of the night.

original: yāmadvayaṃ śayānas tu brahmabhūyāya kalpate //
analyzed: yāma dvayam śayānaḥ tu brahma bhūyāya kalpate
translated: One who sleeps for two watches is fit for becoming Brahman.

original: iti dharmaśāstroktanidrākāle yogasyāyuktatvāc ca / yogakālasyārdharātrikatve svādhyāyakālād vyavahitatvena chidrapāñcakālikatvāpātāc
analyzed: iti dharma śāstra ukta nidrā kāle yogasya ayukta tvāt ca yoga kālasya ārdharātrika tve svādhyāya kālāt vyavahita tvena chidra pāñcakālika tva āpātāt
translated: And because Yoga is not proper at the time of sleep stated in Dharmaśāstra, and because if the time of Yoga were midnight, then there would be a gap in the five times due to being interrupted by the time of Vedic recitation.

original: kālacatuṣtvāsyaivoktatvena abhigamanādiṣv ekasya lopasambhavena aniyatapañcakālaparasya pañcakālaparāyaṇaśabdābhilāpāsambhavāc ca /
analyzed: kāla catuṣtva asya eva uktatvena abhigamana ādiṣu ekasya lopa sambhavena aniyata pañca kāla parasya pañca kāla parāyaṇa śabda abhilāpa asambhavāt ca
translated: Because it is said that there are only four times, and because it is possible for one of them to be omitted in the case of visiting and so on, and because it is not possible to speak of one who is devoted to the five times with an unspecified number of times.

original: tathā /
analyzed: tathā
translated: Similarly.

original: kliśyantīha suṣuptānām indriyāṇi dravanti ca /
analyzed: kliśyanti iha suṣuptānām indriyāṇi dravanti ca
translated: The senses of those who sleep here are afflicted and flow.

original: aṅgāni samatāṃ yānti uttamāny adhamais saha //
analyzed: aṅgāni samatām yānti uttamāni adhamaiḥ saha
translated: The superior limbs become equal to the inferior ones.

original: iti dharmaśāstreṣu prātar ārabhya sāyaṅkālaparyantam eva karmācaraṇakālatvena pratipādanāt /
analyzed: iti dharma śāstreṣu prātar ārabhya sāyaṅkāla paryantam eva karma ācaraṇa kāla tvena pratipādanāt
translated: Thus, in the Dharma Shastras, the time for performing rituals is taught to begin in the morning and end in the evening.

original: tathā /
analyzed: tathā
translated: Similarly.

original: atyantamalinaḥ kāyo navacchidrasamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: atyanta malinaḥ kāyaḥ nava chidra samanvitaḥ
translated: The body is extremely dirty and endowed with nine holes.

original: sravaty eva divārātraṃ prātas snānaṃ viśodhanam //
analyzed: sravati eva divārātram prātar snānam viśodhanam
translated: It flows day and night, and morning bathing is purifying.

original: asnātvā nācaret karma japahomādi kiñcana /
analyzed: a snātvā na ācaret karma japa homa ādi kiñcana
translated: Without bathing, one should not perform any ritual, such as japa and homa.

original: snātvādhikārī bhavati daive pitrye ca karmaṇi //🔽iti smṛteḥ snānāt pūrvaṃ tattvasṛṣṭer ayuktatvāc ca / pretaprāyasya saṃhṛtatattvasya
analyzed: snātvā adhikārī bhavati daive pitrye ca karmaṇi  iti smṛteḥ snānāt pūrvam tattva sṛṣṭeḥ ayukta tvāt ca preta prāyasya saṃhṛta tattvasya
translated: By bathing, one becomes qualified for divine and ancestral rites.🔽Thus, because it is not proper for the creation of the principles to take place before bathing, and because

original: svāpayogyatāsambhavāc ca / tasmāt abbhakṣo vāyubhakṣa ityādiśabdavadavadhāraṇagarbhasya
analyzed: svāpa yogya tā sambhavāt ca tasmāt abbhakṣaḥ vāyubhakṣaḥ ityādi śabda vat avadhāraṇa garbhasya
translated: the state of being a ghost is suitable for one whose principles have been withdrawn, therefore, like the words subsisting on water, subsisting on air and so on, this word

original: pāñcakālikaśabdasya aniyataparimitapāñcakālikeṣu pāñcarātrikeṣu prayogāsaṃbhavād
analyzed: pāñcakālika śabdasya aniyata parimita pāñcakālikeṣu pāñcarātrikeṣu prayoga asaṃbhavāt
translated: Because the word pañca-kālika cannot be used for those who perform the five-time worship at unspecified limited times,

original: aniyataparimitachidrapāñcakālikāḥ pāñcarātriṇo na niyatāchidrapañcakālaparāyaṇavaikhānasatulyā🔽bhavitum ahantīti siddham /
analyzed: aniyata parimita chidra pāñcakālikāḥ pāñcarātriṇaḥ na niyata a chidra pañcakāla parāyaṇa vaikhānasa tulyā  bhavitum ahanti iti siddham
translated: it is established that those who perform the five-time worship at unspecified limited times are not equal to the Vaikhānasa ascetics who are devoted to the five-time worship at specified times without gaps.

original: devatāpūjakasāmānasya devalakatvam ity ākṣepaparihāraḥ
analyzed: devatā pūjaka sāmānasya devalaka tvam iti ākṣepa parihāraḥ
translated: The refutation of the objection that one who worships deities is a devalaka

original: nanu /
analyzed: nanu
translated: Indeed.

original: yo devaṃ pūjayed vipro vittārthī vatsaratrayam /
analyzed: yaḥ devam pūjayet vipraḥ vitta arthī vatsara trayam
translated: If a brahmin worships a deity for three years for the sake of wealth,

original: sa vai devalako nāma havyakavyabahiṣkṛtaḥ //
analyzed: sa vai devalakaḥ nāma havya kavya bahiṣkṛtaḥ
translated: he is called a devalaka, excluded from havya and kavya offerings.

original: iti devatāpūjakasya devalakatvaṃ sambhavatīti cet tad asat / sāmānyataḥ devatārādhanaṃ ye kurvanti te devalakā iti vā /
analyzed: iti devatā pūjakasya devalaka tvam sambhavati iti ced tat asat sāmānyatas devatā ārādhanam ye kurvanti te devalakāḥ iti vā
translated: If it is argued that it is possible for one who worships deities to be a devalaka, that is not so. Either those who worship deities in general are devalakas,

original: uta śrutismṛtītihāsapurāṇādiṣu mukhyādhikāritvena pratipāditā apīti vā /
analyzed: uta śruti smṛti itihāsa purāṇa ādiṣu mukhya adhikāri tvena pratipāditāḥ api iti vā
translated: or those who are taught as having primary authority in the Vedas, Smritis, Itihāsas, Purāṇas, etc.

original: sāmānyataḥ devatārādhanaṃ ye kurvanti te iti cet tarhi gṛhadevatāpūjakānām api devalakatvaprasaṅgaḥ / kiñca /
analyzed: sāmānyatas devatā ārādhanam ye kurvanti te iti ced tarhi gṛha devatā pūjakānām api devalaka tva prasaṅgaḥ kiñca
translated: If it is argued that those who worship deities in general are devalakas, then it would follow that even those who worship household deities are devalakas. Moreover.

original: vaikhānasānām devalakatvābhāvaḥ
analyzed: vaikhānasānām devalaka tva abhāvaḥ
translated: The absence of devalakatva in the Vaikhānasa ascetics

original: brahmacārī gṛhasthaś ca vipro vaikhānasas tathā /
analyzed: brahmacārī gṛhasthaḥ ca vipraḥ vaikhānasaḥ tathā
translated: The Brahmana, the householder, the Vaikhānasa, and the celibate student,

original: kurvanti nijakarmāṇi viṣṇum eva yajanti te //
analyzed: kurvanti nija karmāṇi viṣṇum eva yajanti te
translated: performing their own duties, worship Vishnu alone.

original: iti sandhyopāsanādīnāṃ bhagavadārādhanarūpatvoktyā teṣāñ ca tyāgas sambhavati /
analyzed: iti sandhyā upāsana ādīnām bhagavat ārādhana rūpa tva uktyā teṣām ca tyāgaḥ sambhavati
translated: Thus, by stating that the worship of the sandhya and other rites are forms of propitiating the Lord, their abandonment is also possible.🔽Therefore, it is inappropriate to say generally.

original: atas sāmānyataḥ iti vaktum ayuktam / śrutismṛtipurāṇādiṣu mukhyādhikāritvena pratipāditā
analyzed: atas sāmānyatas iti vaktum ayuktam śruti smṛti purāṇa ādiṣu mukhya adhikāri tvena pratipāditā
translated: If it is argued that the Devalakas are taught as having primary authority in the Vedas, Smritis, Puranas, etc., that is not so.

original: devalakāḥ iti cet tad asat / 'agnir vai devānām avamo viṣṇuḥ paramas tadantareṇa sarvā anyā devatā' /🔽iti brāhmaṇam / tasmād gṛhe paramaṃ viṣṇuṃ pratiṣṭhāpya sāyaṃ prātar homānte 'rcayati iti vaikhānasasūtre /
analyzed: devalakāḥ iti ced tat asat agniḥ vai devānām avamaḥ viṣṇuḥ paramaḥ tad antareṇa sarvāḥ anyāḥ devatāḥ  iti brāhmaṇam tasmāt gṛhe paramam viṣṇum pratiṣṭhāpya sāyam prātar homa ante rcayati iti vaikhānasa sūtre
translated: Vishnu is the highest of the gods, Agni is the lowest, and all other deities are in between them.🔽Thus, in the Vaikhānasa Sutra, it is stated: Having installed the highest Vishnu in the house, one worships him at the end of the evening and morning oblations.

original: pravaḥ pāntam andhaso dhiyāyate maheśūrāya viṣṇave cārcata iti ṛgbrāhmaṇam anusṛtya
analyzed: pravaḥ pāntam andhasaḥ dhiyāyate maheśūrāya viṣṇave ca arcate iti ṛk brāhmaṇam anusṛtya
translated: Following the Rig Veda Brahmana: The protector of the people is praised with wisdom at the time of the soma drink. Worship Vishnu, the great hero.

original: viṣṇupradhānatayā sa vā eṣa puruṣaḥ pañcadhā pañcātmā ityādiśrutyuktaviṣṇvādipañcamūrtīnām
analyzed: viṣṇu pradhāna tayā sa vai eṣa puruṣaḥ pañcadhā pañca ātmā ityādi śruti ukta viṣṇu ādi pañca mūrtīnām
translated: The worship of the five forms of Vishnu and others, as stated in the Vedas such as This person is fivefold, with five selves, is taught.

original: ārādhanasya pratipāditatvāt /
analyzed: ārādhanasya pratipādita tvāt
translated: Therefore, it is established.

original: āśvamedhike kathaṃ tvam arcanīyo 'sītyādeḥ /
analyzed: āśvamedhike katham tvam
translated: Because it is said in the Aśvamedhika [Purāṇa]: How are you to be worshipped by us?

original: vṛddhamanau vedāntavedibhir ityādeś coktatvāt /
analyzed: vṛddha manau vedānta vedibhiḥ ityādeḥ ca ukta tvāt
translated: And because it is said in the Vṛddhamāna [Purāṇa]: By those who know the Vedānta.

original: evam eva pāñcarātraśaivaśilpajyautiṣādiṣu utkṛṣṭamukhyādhikāripratipādakānāṃ
analyzed: evam eva pāñcarātra śaiva śilpa jyautiṣa ādiṣu utkṛṣṭa mukhya adhikāri pratipādakānām
translated: In the same way, in the Pāñcarātra, Śaiva, Śilpa, Jyotiṣa, etc., the statements that teach the excellent and principal qualified persons

original: vacanānāṃ vaiyarthyaprasaṅgāt tanmūlabhūtaśrutismṛtipurāṇādīnām aprāmāṇyaprasaṅgo duṣpariharaḥ /
analyzed: vacanānām vaiyarthya prasaṅgāt tad mūla bhūta śruti smṛti purāṇa ādīnām aprāmāṇya prasaṅgaḥ duṣpariharaḥ
translated: are meaningless, and the irrelevance of the irrelevance of the Vedas, Smṛtis, Purāṇas, etc. that are their basis is difficult to overcome.

original: vaikhānasānām bhagavaddravyopabhogādau doṣābhāvaḥ🔽evaṃ ca pramāṇabhūteṣu śrutismṛtipurāṇādiṣu pratipāditānām ācārādīnāṃ tyāgaḥ prasajyet /
analyzed: vaikhānasānām bhagavat dravya upabhoga ādau doṣa abhāvaḥ  evam ca pramāṇa bhūteṣu śruti smṛti purāṇa ādiṣu pratipāditānām ācāra ādīnām tyāgaḥ prasajyet
translated: The absence of fault for the Vaikhānasas in the enjoyment of the Lord's wealth, etc.

original: niṣphalatvāt / nanu paradravyoṇālayārcanaṃ kurvatāṃ devalakatvam iti cet na /
analyzed: niṣphala tvāt nanu para dravya ūṇa ālaya arcanam kurvatām devalaka tvam iti ced na
translated: And thus, the abandonment of the conduct, etc. taught in the authoritative Vedas, Smṛtis, Purāṇas, etc. would follow, because they are fruitless. If it is argued that those who worship in the house of others' wealth become Devalakas, it is not so.

original: śrutismṛtipurāṇādiṣu tattacchāstreṣu ca ālayārcakānāṃ mukhyādhikāritvena taddravyopabhogārhatvena ca pratipādanāt /
analyzed: śruti smṛti purāṇa ādiṣu tad tad śāstreṣu ca ālaya arcakānām mukhya adhikāri tvena tad dravya upabhoga arha tvena ca pratipādanāt
translated: Because in the Vedas, Smṛtis, Purāṇas, etc. and in those scriptures, the worshipers in the house are taught as the principal qualified persons and as deserving to enjoy that wealth.

original: yathā marīciproktāyām ānandasaṃhitāyāṃ vikhanasotpattyādikaṃ pratipādya /
analyzed: yathā marīci proktāyām ānandasaṃhitāyām pratipādya
translated: As in the Ānandasaṃhitā spoken by Marīci, after teaching the origin of the Vaikhānasas, etc.

original: tathā tvadanujīvitve tvaddravyānubhave sati /
analyzed: tathā tvad anujīvi tve tvad dravya anubhave sati
translated: Similarly, if one depends on you for livelihood and experiences your wealth,

original: yad bhaved doṣa utpanna iti cintākulo 'smy aham // ĀS /
analyzed: yat bhavet doṣaḥ utpannaḥ iti cintā ākulaḥ smi aham
translated: I am anxious about what faults may arise.

original: iti bhagavaddravyopajīvanadoṣabhīroḥ vikhanasaḥ bhagavantaṃ prati praśne
analyzed: iti bhagavat dravya upajīvana doṣa bhīroḥ vikhanasaḥ bhagavantam prati praśne
translated: Thus, the sage Vālmīki, afraid of the fault of using the wealth of the Lord, asked the Lord.

original: athovāca hṛṣīkeśo bhīruṃ taṃ munisattamaṃ / ĀS /
analyzed: athā uvāca hṛṣīkeśaḥ bhīrum tam muni sattamam
translated: Then Hṛṣīkeśa said to that timid best of sages:

original: vaikhānasānāṃ tad doṣo nāsti matkṛtakarmaṇām // ĀS /
analyzed: vaikhānasānām tat doṣaḥ na asti mad kṛta karmaṇām
translated: That fault does not exist for the Vālmīki sages who perform my rites.

original: maddravyaṃ havyakavyārthe dānābhyāgatapūjane / ĀS /
analyzed: mad dravyam havya kavya arthe dāna abhyāgata pūjane
translated: My wealth is for the purpose of havya and kavya, and for honoring guests with gifts.

original: mukhyam evāstu bhavatāṃ sadā matkarma kurvatām // Ā /S /
analyzed: mukhyam eva astu bhavatām sadā mad karma kurvatām
translated: Let it always be the primary [source of livelihood] for you who always perform my rites.

original: vaikhānasānām bhagavadvigrahavikraye 'pi doṣābhāvaḥ
analyzed: vaikhānasānām bhagavat vigraha vikraye doṣa abhāvaḥ
translated: Even in the sale of the Lord's image, there is no fault for the Vālmīki sages.

original: kim ebhir bahubhir vākyair anyat te kathayāmy aham // ĀS /🔽maddravyakṣetrabimbānām ālayānāṃ tathāpadi /
analyzed: kim ebhiḥ bahubhiḥ vākyaiḥ anyat te kathayāmi aham  mad dravya kṣetra bimbānām ālayānām tathā āpadi
translated: What is the use of these many statements? I shall tell you something else.🔽In the case of calamities regarding my wealth, fields, images, and temples,

original: vikrīṇanādikāryeṣu nāsti doṣo madājñayā // ĀS /
analyzed: vikrīṇana ādi kāryeṣu na asti doṣaḥ mad ājñayā
translated: there is no fault in selling and other such acts by my order.

original: tasmād bhavān abhimatas sarvaṃ karma sadā kuru // ĀS
analyzed: tasmāt bhavān abhimataḥ sarvam karma sadā kuru
translated: Therefore, you are my favorite. Always perform all rites.

original: madīyadhanabhogena matkriyālopatas tava /
analyzed: madīya dhana bhogena mad kriyā lopataḥ tava
translated: Due to using my wealth and neglecting my rites,

original: maccharīratayā satyam apacāro na vidyate // ĀS /
analyzed: mad śarīra tayā satyam apacāraḥ na vidyate
translated: There is no doubt that by identifying with my body, there is no fault.

original: iti bhagavadvacanodāharaṇena bhagavaddravyopabhogādiṣu doṣābhāvaḥ pratipāditaḥ /
analyzed: iti bhagavat vacana udāharaṇena bhagavat dravya upabhoga ādiṣu doṣa abhāvaḥ pratipāditaḥ
translated: Thus, by citing the words of the Lord, the absence of faults in enjoying the Lord's wealth etc. is taught.

original: atra ahaṃ bhaktaparādhīno hy asvatantra iva dvija ityādivacanānusāreṇārcakaparādhīnatāṃ darśayituṃ /
analyzed: atra aham bhakta para adhīnaḥ hi asvatantraḥ iva dvijaḥ ityādi vacana anusāreṇa arcaka para adhīna tām darśayitum
translated: Here, in accordance with the statement I am dependent on the devotee, like a Brahmin who is not independent, etc., in order to show dependence on the worshipper,

original: bhagavatprītiviṣayīkṛtānāṃ vaikhānasānāṃ taddravyopabhogādiṣu doṣagandho nāstīti🔽pratipādanāvasare maddravyaṃ kṣetrabimbādītyādinā kaimutikanyāyam abhipretya bhagavadvigrahavikraye
analyzed: bhagavat prīti viṣayīkṛtānām vaikhānasānām tad dravya upabhoga ādiṣu doṣa gandhaḥ na asti iti  pratipādana avasare mad dravyam kṣetra bimba ādi ityādinā kaimutika nyāyam abhipretya bhagavat vigraha vikraye
translated: and on the occasion of teaching that there is no trace of fault in the enjoyment of that wealth etc. of the Vaikhānasas who have been made objects of the Lord's love,

original: kṛte 'pi doṣo nāstīty ucyate / tāvatā na tad abhipretam /
analyzed: kṛte doṣaḥ na asti iti ucyate tāvatā na tat abhipretam
translated: with the intention of the logical principle of the more so by the words my wealth, the icon of the deity etc., it is said that even when the Lord's image is sold, there is no fault. That is not intended by that.

original: nanv evam api devadravyopabhogadoṣas sāmānyataḥ mukhyāmukhyādhikāriṣu sarveṣv āpadyate eva iti cet na /🔽māṃsabhakṣane narakapatanam
analyzed: nanu evam api deva dravya upabhoga doṣaḥ sāmānyatas mukhya amukhya adhikāriṣu sarveṣu āpadyate eva iti ced na  māṃsa bhakṣane naraka patanam
translated: Even so, the fault of enjoying the wealth of the deity occurs in all the primary and secondary qualified persons in general, isn't it? No.🔽Falling into hell by eating meat

original: ye bhakṣayanti māṃsāni sattvānāṃ jīvitaiṣiṇām /
analyzed: ye bhakṣayanti māṃsāni sattvānām jīvita eṣiṇām
translated: Those who eat the flesh of living beings who desire to live,

original: bhakṣyante te 'pi tais sarvair iti brahmābravīt svayam // MBh / /
analyzed: bhakṣyante te pi taiḥ sarvaiḥ iti brahmā abravīt svayam
translated: They too are eaten by all of them, this Brahma himself has said.

original: māṃ sa bhakṣayitām utra yasya māṃsam ihādmy aham /
analyzed: mām sa bhakṣayitām utra yasya māṃsam iha admi aham
translated: He who eats my flesh here, let him eat me in the next world.

original: etan māṃsasya māṃsatvaṃ pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ // MBh / /
analyzed: etat māṃsasya māṃsa tvam pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: This is what the wise declare to be the nature of meat.

original: na hi māṃsaṃ tṛṇāt kaṣṭhād upalād vāpi jayate /
analyzed: na hi māṃsam tṛṇāt kaṣṭhāt upalāt vā api jayate
translated: Meat does not come from grass, wood, or stone.

original: hatvā jantuṃ bhaven māṃsaṃ tasmāt tat parivarjayet // MBh / /🔽hantā caivānumantā ca viśas tā krayavikrayī /
analyzed: hatvā jantum bhavet māṃsam tasmāt tat parivarjayet  hantā ca eva anumantā ca viśaḥ krayavikrayī
translated: Meat comes from killing a living being, therefore one should avoid it.

original: saṃskartā copakartā ca khādakaś cāṣṭa ghātukāḥ // MBh / /
analyzed: saṃskartā ca upakartā ca khādakaḥ ca aṣṭa ghātukāḥ
translated: The killer, the approver, the butcher, the seller, the preparer, the server, and the eater - these are the eight kinds of killers.

original: dhanena krāyako hanti khādakaś copabhogataḥ /
analyzed: dhanena krāyakaḥ hanti khādakaḥ ca upabhogataḥ
translated: The buyer kills through money, the eater through enjoyment,

original: ghātuko vadhabandhābhyām ity eṣa trividho vadhaḥ // MBh / /
analyzed: ghātukaḥ vadha bandhābhyām iti eṣa trividhaḥ vadhaḥ
translated: and the killer through killing and binding - thus killing is of three kinds.

original: svamāṃsaṃ paramāṃsena yo vardhayitum icchati /
analyzed: sva māṃsam para māṃsena yaḥ vardhayitum icchati
translated: He who wishes to increase his own flesh with the flesh of others,

original: nāradaḥ prāha dharmātmā narake sa vipacyate // MBh / /🔽kutracid dharmasyāpy adharmaṃ /
analyzed: nāradaḥ prāha dharma ātmā narake sa vipacyate  kutracid dharmasya api adharmam
translated: Narada, the righteous one, says he will be cooked in hell.🔽In some cases, even dharma becomes adharma,

original: adharmasyāpi dharmatvañ ca
analyzed: adharmasya api dharma tvam ca
translated: and adharma becomes dharma.

original: ityādi vacanaiḥ māṃsabhakṣaṇena narakapatanasmaraṇāt bhagavatprītyarthaṃ🔽kriyamāṇeṣu yajñeṣv api māṃsabhakṣaṇasattvāt yājñikānām api narakapatanaṃ sambhavatīti
analyzed: ityādi vacanaiḥ māṃsa bhakṣaṇena naraka patana smaraṇāt bhagavat prīti artham  kriyamāṇeṣu yajñeṣu api māṃsa bhakṣaṇa sattvāt yājñikānām api naraka patanam sambhavati iti
translated: Thus, by remembering the fall into hell through eating meat, even in sacrifices performed for the sake of pleasing the Lord,🔽since there is the existence of eating meat, the fall into hell of the sacrificers is also possible.

original: yāgasyāpi tyāgaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: yāgasya api tyāga prasaṅgāt
translated: Therefore, there is the possibility of abandoning even the sacrifice.

original: tasmāc chāstraṃ pramāṇaṃ te kāryākāryavyavasthitau /
analyzed: tasmāt śāstram pramāṇam te kārya akārya vyavasthitau
translated: Therefore, the scriptures are the authority for you in determining what should be done and what should not be done.

original: jñātvā śāstravidhānoktaṃ karma kartum ihārhasi // MBh / /
analyzed: jñātvā śāstra vidhāna uktam karma kartum iha arhasi
translated: Having known the rites prescribed by the scriptures, it is proper for you to perform them here.

original: iti bhagavadvacanāt śāstroktānāṃ karmaṇāṃ doṣo nāstīti cet / maddravyopabhogādau
analyzed: iti bhagavat vacanāt śāstra uktānām karmaṇām doṣaḥ na asti iti ced mad dravya upabhoga ādau
translated: If it is argued that there is no fault in the rites prescribed by the scriptures, because it has been stated by the Lord that there is no fault in enjoying my wealth etc.,

original: doṣo nāstīti bhagavatā pratipāditvāt prakṛte 'pi doṣo nāsty eva / vacanāt pravṛttir
analyzed: doṣaḥ nā asti iti bhagavatā pratipādi tvāt prakṛte doṣaḥ nā asti eva vacanāt pravṛttiḥ
translated: since it has been taught by the Lord that there is no fault even in the present case, and that engagement is by the statement

original: vacanān nivṛttir iti khalu śiṣṭoktiḥ / evaṃ kutracid dharmo 'dharmaḥ adharmaś ca dharmo bhavati /
analyzed: vacanāt nivṛttiḥ iti khalu śiṣṭa uktiḥ evam kutracid dharmaḥ dharmaḥ adharmaḥ ca dharmaḥ bhavati
translated: and disengagement is by the statement, this is indeed the statement of the learned. Thus, in some cases, what is dharma becomes adharma and what is adharma becomes dharma.

original: yathā
analyzed: yathā
translated: For example,

original: ukte 'nṛte bhavet kiñcit prāṇināṃ prāṇarakṣaṇam /
analyzed: ukte nṛte bhavet kiñcid prāṇinām prāṇa rakṣaṇam
translated: if by speaking an untruth, there is some protection of the lives of beings,

original: anṛtaṃ tatra satyaṃ syāt satyam atrānṛtaṃ bhavet //
analyzed: anṛtam tatra satyam syāt satyam atra anṛtam bhavet
translated: that untruth would be truth and that truth would become untruth.

original: kāminīṣu vivāheṣu gavāṃ pīḍāsu bādhane /
analyzed: kāminīṣu vivāheṣu gavām pīḍāsu bādhane
translated: In the case of women, in marriages, in the affliction of cows, in oppression,

original: brāhmaṇābhyavapattau ca śapathe nāsti pātakam //
analyzed: brāhmaṇa abhyavapattau ca śapathe na asti pātakam
translated: And there is no sin in taking an oath in a dispute with a Brahmin.

original: yadbrāhmaṇaś cābrāhmaṇaś ca praśnam eyātāṃ brāhmaṇāyādhibrūyāt yadbrāhmaṇāyādhyātmane
analyzed: yat brāhmaṇaḥ ca abrāhmaṇaḥ ca praśnam eyātām brāhmaṇāya adhibrūyāt yat brāhmaṇāya adhyātmane
translated: And there is a Vedic text: 'If a Brahmin and a non-Brahmin were to ask a question, he should answer the Brahmin. What he utters to the Brahmin,

original: 'dhyāha yad brāhmaṇaṃ parāhātmānaṃ parāha tasmād brāhmaṇo na parocyaḥ ity śrutiś ca /
analyzed: dhyāha yat brāhmaṇam parāha ātmānam parāha tasmāt brāhmaṇaḥ na parocyaḥ iti śrutiḥ ca
translated: he utters to the self. What he says to the Brahmin, he says to the self. Therefore, a Brahmin should not be spoken ill of.'

original: śrautasūtre ca /
analyzed: śrautasūtre ca
translated: And in the Vedic Sutras:

original: sarva evam abhivādayanti nābhivādayati na juhoty anyatra somāṅgebhyaḥ ityādi pratipādyate /
analyzed: sarve evam abhivādayanti na abhivādayati na juhoti anyatra soma aṅgebhyaḥ ityādi pratipādyate
translated: 'All should greet, not greet, not offer oblations, except in the Soma rites,' and so on is taught.

original: sarvasvaharaṇe bhāryāveśyayoḥ /
analyzed: sarva sva haraṇe bhāryā veśyayoḥ
translated: In the case of confiscation of all property, of wife and daughter,

original: prāṇasaṃśaye /
analyzed: prāṇa saṃśaye
translated: in a matter of life and death,

original: godvijārthe vivāde ca śapathe nāsti pātakam //
analyzed: go dvija arthe vivāde ca śapathe na asti pātakam
translated: in a dispute for the sake of cows and Brahmins, there is no sin in taking an oath.

original: ityādi smṛtiś ca /
analyzed: ityādi smṛtiḥ ca
translated: And so on is stated in the Smritis.

original: evaṃ ca śāstroktaprakāreṇa bhagavadarcanaṃ kurvatāṃ taddravyopabhoge na doṣaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca śāstra ukta prakāreṇa bhagavat arcanam kurvatām tad dravya upabhoge na doṣaḥ
translated: And thus, for those who worship the Lord in the manner prescribed by the scriptures, there is no fault in enjoying those substances.

original: devalakatvalakṣaṇavicāraḥ
translated: Discussion on the characteristics of being a Devalaka

original: kiñca kiṃ devalakatvaṃ jātiparam /
analyzed: kiñca kim devalaka tvam jāti param
translated: Moreover, is being a Devalaka based on caste?

original: uta karmaparam /
analyzed: uta karma param
translated: Or is it based on action?

original: jātiparam iti vaktuṃ na śakyate / tathānuktatvāt / icchayā kalpitum aśakyatvāc ca /
analyzed: jāti param iti vaktum na śakyate tathā anukta tvāt icchayā kalpitum aśakya tvāt ca
translated: It cannot be said to be based on caste, because it is not stated as such, and because it cannot be assumed by one's own will.

original: avihitakarmakartṛtvam eva devalakatvam
analyzed: avihita karma kartṛ tvam eva devalaka tvam
translated: Being one who does not perform the enjoined actions is itself being a Devala.

original: atha karmaparam iti cet / vihitakarmaparam /
analyzed: atha karma param iti ced vihita karma param
translated: If it is argued that it refers to actions, then it refers to enjoined actions.

original: uta avihitakarmaparam /
analyzed: uta avihita karma param
translated: Or does it refer to un-enjoined actions?

original: vihitakarmaparam iti vaktum aśakyam śrutismṛtītihāsasūtrapurāṇādīnām apramāṇyaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: vihita karma param iti vaktum aśakyam śruti smṛti itihāsa sūtra purāṇa ādīnām apramāṇya prasaṅgāt
translated: It cannot be said to refer to enjoined actions, because that would lead to the invalidity of the Vedas, Smritis, Itihasas, Sutras, Puranas, etc.

original: vihitadharmaparatvenānuktatvāt /🔽śrutismṛtī mamaivājñā yas tām ullaṅghya vartate /
analyzed: śruti smṛtī mama eva ājñā yaḥ tām ullaṅghya vartate
translated: Because they are not stated to refer to enjoined duties.🔽The Vedas and Smritis are my own commands. One who acts in violation of them,

original: ājñāc chedī mama drohī madbhakto 'pi na vaiṣṇavaḥ //
analyzed: ājñāt chedī mama drohī mad bhaktaḥ na vaiṣṇavaḥ
translated: is a cutter of the command, an enemy of mine, and even a devotee of mine is not a Vaishnava.

original: paradravyakṛtasyāpy ārādhanasya nirdoṣatvam
analyzed: para dravya kṛtasya api ārādhanasya nirdoṣa tvam
translated: Even the worship performed with others' wealth is faultless.

original: iti bhagavadājñābhaṅgadoṣāc ca / evaṃ ca avihitakarmaparam iti hi pariśiṣyate /
analyzed: iti bhagavat ājñā bhaṅga doṣāt ca evam ca avihita karma param iti hi pariśiṣyate
translated: And because of the fault of violating the Lord's command in this way, it remains that it refers to un-enjoined actions.

original: nanu paradravyeṇa kṛtaṃ bhagavadārādhanaṃ kratuvat parārtham eva bhavatīti cet maivam /
analyzed: nanu para dravyeṇa kṛtam bhagavat ārādhanam kratu vat para artham eva bhavati iti ced mā evam
translated: If it is argued that the worship of the Lord performed with others' wealth is for the sake of others like a sacrifice, it is not so.

original: anyadharmaparo vipro bhraṣṭo gacchaty adhogatim /
analyzed: anya dharma paraḥ vipraḥ bhraṣṭaḥ gacchati adhogatim
translated: A Brahmin devoted to the duties of others falls and goes to a lower state.

original: matkarmanirato vipro nādhaḥ patati kutracit //
analyzed: mad karma nirataḥ vipraḥ na adhas patati kutracid
translated: A Brahmin devoted to my actions never falls anywhere.

original: iti bhagavadvacanāt /
analyzed: iti bhagavat vacanāt
translated: This is the statement of the Lord.

original: purāṇāntare /
analyzed: purāṇa antare
translated: In another Purana.

original: svasminn arpitamātreṇa yena kenāpi karmaṇā /
analyzed: svasmin arpita mātreṇa yena kena api karmaṇā
translated: By merely dedicating himself to any action whatsoever,

original: tuṣṭo dadāti svapadam aho vatsalatā hareḥ // iti /
analyzed: tuṣṭaḥ dadāti sva padam aho vatsala tā hareḥ iti
translated: the Lord, being pleased, grants His own abode. Ah! The affection of Hari.

original: kiñca /
analyzed: kiñca
translated: And furthermore,

original: dakṣiṇāpratigrahe doṣābhavaḥ
analyzed: dakṣiṇā pratigrahe doṣa abhavaḥ
translated: there is no fault in accepting Dakṣiṇā.

original: ekaviṃśatiniṣkantu dadyād ācāryadakṣiṇām /
analyzed: ekaviṃśati niṣkam tu dadyāt ācārya dakṣiṇām
translated: One should give twenty-one Niṣkas as the Dakṣiṇā to the Ācārya.

original: ṛtvijān tu tadardhaṃ syāt tadardham itarasya ca //
analyzed: ṛtvijān tu tad ardham syāt tad ardham itarasya ca
translated: To the Ṛtviks it should be half of that, and half of that to the others.

original: iti dakṣiṇādānaṃ pratipādyate /🔽nanu pratigraheṇa viprasya brāhmaṃ tejo vinaśyati //
analyzed: iti dakṣiṇā dānam pratipādyate  nanu pratigraheṇa viprasya brāhmam tejaḥ vinaśyati
translated: Thus the giving of Dakṣiṇā is taught.

original: iti manuvacanāt ManuDhŚ /
analyzed: iti manuvacanāt manudhś
translated: But doesn't the statement of Manu say that by accepting gifts, the Brahmic splendor of a Brāhmaṇa is destroyed?

original: pratigraheṇa tejo hi viprāṇāṃ śāmyate ity ānuśāsanikavacanāc ca pratigraheṇa
analyzed: pratigraheṇa tejaḥ hi viprāṇām śāmyate iti ānuśāsanika vacanāt ca pratigraheṇa
translated: And by the statement in the Ānuśāsanika, Indeed, the splendor of the Brāhmaṇas is pacified by accepting gifts,

original: brahmatejonāśanaṃ smaryate / śrūyate pratigrahe prāyaścittam api / yo yājayati prati
analyzed: brahma tejaḥ nāśanam smaryate śrūyate pratigrahe prāyaścittam api yaḥ yājayati prati
translated: the destruction of Brahmic splendor by accepting gifts is remembered. And a penance is also heard for accepting gifts. He who performs a sacrifice

original: vā gṛhṇāti yājayitvā pratigṛhya vānaśnaṃs tris svādhyāyam adhīyīta trirātraṃ sāvitrīṃ
analyzed: vā gṛhṇāti yājayitvā pratigṛhya vā an aśnan tris svādhyāyam adhīyīta tri rātram sāvitrīm
translated: or accepts gifts, having performed a sacrifice or accepted gifts, should recite his own Veda three times without eating, and for three nights he should recite the Gāyatrī Sāvitrī

original: gāyatrīm anvatirecayati varo dakṣiṇā vareṇaiva varaṃ spṛṇoty ātmā hi varaḥ iti /
analyzed: gāyatrīm anvatirecayati varaḥ dakṣiṇā vareṇa eva varam spṛṇoti ātmā hi varaḥ iti
translated: in excess. The Dakṣiṇā is a boon. By the boon he wins the boon. The boon is the self.

original: ataḥ pratigrahe doṣo 'stīti cet na /
analyzed: atas pratigrahe doṣaḥ sti iti ced na
translated: Therefore, if it is argued that there is a fault in accepting gifts, it is not so.

original: harismaraṇasya mokṣapradatvam
translated: The bestowal of liberation by the remembrance of Hari

original: trāyante khalu nātyantam anyadharmās svanuṣṭitāḥ /
analyzed: trāyante khalu na atyantam anya dharmāḥ su anuṣṭitāḥ
translated: Other duties, even if well-performed, do not really protect.

original: api matkarma viguṇaṃ trāyate mahato bhayāt //
analyzed: api mad karma viguṇam trāyate mahataḥ bhayāt
translated: Even my defective action protects from great fear.

original: merumandaramātro 'pi rāśiḥ pāpasya karmaṇaḥ /🔽keśavaṃ vaidyam āsādya ab hier noch Telugu vergleichendurvyādhir iva naśyati //
analyzed: meru mandara mātraḥ pi rāśiḥ pāpasya karmaṇaḥ  keśavam vaidyam āsādya ab hier noch telugu verglichenduḥ vyādhiḥ iva naśyati
translated: Even a heap of sinful action as big as Meru or Mandara,🔽when Keshava, the physician, is resorted to, perishes like a disease.

original: nidhisthānaṃ khanan dveṣāt mṛdarthaṃ vāpnuyān nidhim /
analyzed: nidhi sthānam khanan dveṣāt mṛd artham vā āpnuyāt nidhim
translated: One digging for earth out of hatred for a treasure-house may obtain the treasure.

original: ajñaḥ kāmāc ca doṣāc ca smṛtvaivaṃ mokṣabhāktathā //
analyzed: ajñaḥ kāmāt ca doṣāt ca smṛtvā evam mokṣa bhāj tathā
translated: Similarly, the ignorant, remembering thus out of desire and fault, becomes a candidate for liberation.

original: dveṣiṇā vāprayatnena kṣipto 'gniḥ kakṣamādahet /
analyzed: dveṣiṇā vā aprayatnena kṣiptaḥ agniḥ kakṣam ādahet
translated: Even fire thrown by an enemy without effort would burn a forest.

original: katham abhyarcito viṣṇuḥ na dahet sarvakilbiṣam //
analyzed: katham abhyarcitaḥ viṣṇuḥ na dahet sarva kilbiṣam
translated: How would Vishnu, when worshipped, not burn all sins?

original: yathājño vajrakāyas syāt spardhann api sudhāṃ piban /
analyzed: yathā ajñaḥ vajra kāyaḥ syāt spardhan api sudhām piban
translated: As one ignorant would have a diamond body, even while competing, drinking nectar,

original: evaṃ viruddhabhāvo 'pi mucyaty eva hariṃ smaran // iti
analyzed: evam viruddha bhāvaḥ mucyati eva harim smaran iti
translated: so one of contradictory nature also becomes liberated by remembering Hari. Thus.

original: nāradīye / kṛtāpi dambhahāsyādyair yat sevā tārayej janān /
translated: In Narada's text: Even service done with pride, laughter, etc. would liberate people.

original: viphalā nānyakarmeva kṛpāluḥ ko 'nvataḥ param // NāradaP /
analyzed: viphalā na anya karmā iva kṛpāluḥ kaḥ nu atas param
translated: What other action, like a compassionate one, is superior to this? Narada Parva.

original: hāsyānādaramāyābhir api bhaktiḥ kṛtā tvayi /
analyzed: hāsya anādara māyābhiḥ api bhaktiḥ kṛtā tvayi
translated: Even devotion done to you with laughter, disrespect and deceit,

original: nṛṇāṃ dadātīndrapadaṃ sāttvikānāṃ kim ucyate // NāradaP
analyzed: nṛṇām dadāti indra padam sāttvikānām kim ucyate
translated: gives to men the position of Indra. What to speak of the devotees of Sattva quality?

original: vastusvabhāva evaiṣa yanmokṣāya harismṛtiḥ /
analyzed: vastu svabhāvaḥ eva eṣa yat mokṣāya hari smṛtiḥ
translated: This is the very nature of things that the remembrance of Hari leads to liberation,

original: pūṣeva dhyāntanāśāya śśītaśāntyai yathānalaḥ // NāradaP /🔽saiṣā harismṛtiṛ daityaṃ krodhād api kṛtā satī /
analyzed: pūṣā iva  sā eṣā hari smṛtiṛ daityam krodhāt api kṛtā satī
translated: like the sun to the destruction of darkness, and like fire to the allaying of cold.🔽This very remembrance of Hari, though done out of anger towards a demon,

original: ānayet sadgatiṃ vipraṃ sānugaṃ kimu varṇyate // NāradaP /
analyzed: ānayet sat gatim vipram sa anugam kimu varṇyate
translated: brought the Brāhmaṇa and his followers to a good state. What need be said about those who remember the Lord with devotion?

original: yathāmṛtārthaṃ yatatāṃ surāṇām abdhimanthane /

analyzed: ādityam ambikām viṣṇum gaṇanātham maheśvaram
translated: The Sun, Ambika, Vishnu, Ganesha, Maheshvara,

original: gṛhe pūjā ca ity ete pañcadevalakāḥ smṛtāḥ / // iti
analyzed: gṛhe pūjā ca iti ete pañca devalakāḥ smṛtāḥ iti
translated: These five are known as the Devalakas: the householder, the worshipper, and the three mentioned earlier.

original: viṣṇudharmottare /
analyzed: viṣṇudharmottare
translated: In the Vishnu Dharma Uttara.

original: caṇḍikāyāś ca durgāyā jyeṣṭāyā bhairavasya ca /
analyzed: caṇḍikāyāḥ ca durgāyāḥ jyeṣṭāyāḥ bhairavasya ca
translated: And those who worship Chandika, Durga, Jyeshtha, Bhairava,

original: rudrasya pūjakā ye vai te vai devalakāḥ smṛtāḥ //
analyzed: rudrasya pūjakāḥ ye vai te vai devalakāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: And Rudra, they are known as Devalakas.

original: iti ViṣṇudharmottaraP 🔽viṣṇu / devārcanaparo yo 'pi parārthaṃ vittakāṅkṣayā /
analyzed: iti viṣṇudharma uttarap  viṣṇu deva arcana paraḥ para artham vitta kāṅkṣayā
translated: In the Vishnu Dharma Uttara.🔽Vishnu. One who is devoted to worshipping the gods, even a Brahmin who upholds the four Vedas, out of greed for wealth for the sake of others,

original: caturvedadharo vipraḥ sa caṇḍālasamo bhaved // iti ViṣṇuP
analyzed: catur veda dharaḥ vipraḥ sa caṇḍāla samaḥ bhavet iti viṣṇup
translated: He would be equal to an outcaste.

original: evam ebhir vacanaiḥ śāstrānanumatamārgeṇa pūjakānāṃ devatāntarapūjakānām eva ca devalakatvaṃ siddhyatīti sphuṭam avagamyate /
analyzed: evam ebhiḥ vacanaiḥ śāstra ananumata mārgeṇa pūjakānām devatā antara pūjakānām eva ca devalaka tvam siddhi ati iti sphuṭam avagamyate
translated: Thus, it is clearly understood that by these statements, the status of Devalaka is established only for the worshippers and the worshippers of other deities through a path not approved by the scriptures.

original: kiñca / vṛṣo dharmas samākhyataḥ tasya yaḥ kurute layam /
analyzed: kiñca vṛṣaḥ dharmaḥ samākhyataḥ tasya yaḥ kurute layam
translated: Moreover, Dharma is called a bull. He who causes its downfall,

original: vṛṣalaṃ taṃ vidur devā nikṛṣṭaṃ śvapacād api //
analyzed: vṛṣalam tam viduḥ devāḥ nikṛṣṭam śvapacāt api
translated: The gods know him to be a shudra, inferior even to an outcaste.

original: devalakaśabdanirvacanam
analyzed: devalaka śabda nirvacanam
translated: The etymological explanation of the word Devalaka.

original: iti vṛṣalaśabdo yathā vedaśāstroktamārgalayakārake vyutpāditaḥ /
analyzed: iti vṛṣala śabdaḥ yathā veda śāstra ukta mārga laya kārake vyutpāditaḥ
translated: Thus, the word shudra is derived as one who causes the downfall of the path taught in the Vedas and scriptures.

original: tathā devalakśabdo 'pi div krīḍāvijigīṣāvyavahāradyutistutimodamadasvapnakāntigatiṣv
analyzed: tathā krīḍā vijigīṣā vyavahāra dyuti stuti moda mada svapna kānti gatiṣu
translated: Similarly, the word Devalaka is also derived as one who causes the downfall of the path taught in the Vedas and scriptures, in the sense of play, competition, business, luster, praise, joy, intoxication, sleep, radiance, and movement.

original: iti dhātvarthānusāreṇa gatyaparaparyāyamārgārthakadivdhātughaṭitassan vedoktamārgalayaprāpake🔽vyutpādayituṃ śakyate iti tatpratīpeṣu vedamārgapratiṣṭhāpakeṣu vaikhānaseṣu na sarvātmanā
analyzed: iti dhātvartha anusāreṇa gati apara paryāya mārga arthaka div dhātu ghaṭitaḥ san veda ukta mārga laya prāpake  vyutpādayitum śakyate iti tad pratīpeṣu veda mārga pratiṣṭhāpakeṣu vaikhānaseṣu na sarva ātmanā
translated: Thus, following the meaning of the root, it can be explained that it is capable of producing the attainment of the abode of the path taught in the Vedas.

original: pravartate / tathā ca /
analyzed: pravartate tathā ca
translated: Therefore, it does not operate in its entirety against the Vaikhānasas, who establish the path of the Vedas. And thus,

original: hārītaḥ / vaikhānasās tu ye viprā haripūjanatatparāḥ /
analyzed: hārītaḥ vaikhānasāḥ tu ye viprāḥ hari pūjana tatparāḥ
translated: Hārīta: But those Brahmins who are devoted to the worship of Hari,

original: na te devalakāḥ proktā viṣṇupādābjasaṃśrayāt //
analyzed: na te devalakāḥ proktāḥ viṣṇu pāda abja saṃśrayāt
translated: they are not called Devalakas, because they are devoted to the lotus feet of Vishnu.

original: iti Vṛddhahārīta /
analyzed: iti vṛddhahārīta
translated: Thus, the ancient Hārīta.

original: vaikhānasānaṃ devalakaśabdavācyatvābhāvaḥ
analyzed: devalaka śabda vācya tva abhāvaḥ
translated: The absence of the Vaikhānasas being denoted by the word Devalaka

original: smṛtyarthasāre /
translated: is stated in the Smṛtyartha-sāra.

original: atri /🔽vaidikenaiva vidhinā dambhalobhavivarjitaḥ /
analyzed: atri  vaidikena eva vidhinā dambha lobha vivarjitaḥ
translated: Atri:

original: pūjayed bhaktito viṣṇuṃ sa hi devalako na vai // iti
analyzed: pūjayet bhaktitaḥ viṣṇum sa hi devalakaḥ na vai iti
translated: Free from pride and greed, one should worship Vishnu only according to the Vedic injunctions. He is indeed a Devalaka.

original: anyathā śrutyuktamārgeṇālayārcakānām api devalakatve tādṛśālayārcanapratipādakānāṃ śrutismṛtipurāṇādivacanānāṃ vyarthatā syāt /
analyzed: anyathā śruti ukta mārgeṇa ālaya arcakānām api devalaka tve tādṛśa ālaya arcana pratipādakānām śruti smṛti purāṇa ādi vacanānām vyartha tā syāt
translated: Otherwise, if those who worship in the abode according to the path stated in the scriptures are also Devalakas, then the statements in the scriptures, Smṛtis, Purāṇas, etc. that teach such worship in the abode would be useless.

original: nanu ajñānataḥ kṛtam api bhagavadārādhanam apavargapradañ cet / vinā śāstraṃ anadhikāriṇāpi kṛtaṃ tatapavargapradaṃ kiṃ na syād
analyzed: nanu ajñānataḥ kṛtam api bhagavat ārādhanam apavarga pradam ced vinā śāstram anadhikāriṇā api kṛtam tat apavarga pradam kim na syāt
translated: If the worship of the Lord, even done unknowingly, grants liberation, then why would it not grant liberation when done by one not qualified, without scripture?

original: iti cet / na / bhagavadājñābhaṅgāpatteḥ /
analyzed: iti ced na bhagavat ājñā bhaṅga āpatteḥ
translated: If this is asked, no, because it would be a violation of the Lord's command.

original: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā /
analyzed: yathā uktam bhagavatā
translated: As the Lord has said:

original: yaś śāstravidhim utsṛjya vartate kāmakārataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ śāstra vidhim utsṛjya vartate kāmakārataḥ
translated: One who acts according to his own desire, abandoning the injunction of scripture,

original: na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṃ na parāṃ gatim // iti MBh / /🔽śrutismṛtī mamaivājñā yas tām ullaṅghya vartate /
analyzed: na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukham na parām gatim iti  śruti smṛtī mama eva ājñā yaḥ tām ullaṅghya vartate
translated: does not attain perfection, nor happiness, nor the highest goal. (MBh)🔽My injunctions are the Vedas and the Smritis. One who acts in violation of them,

original: ājñācchedī mama drohī madbhakto 'pi na vaiṣṇavaḥ // iti
analyzed: ājñā chedī mama drohī mad bhaktaḥ na vaiṣṇavaḥ iti
translated: even if he is my devotee, is not a true Vaishnava, for he is an enemy who cuts off my command. (Padma Purana)

original: mama cāpi priyaṃ viṣṇor devadevasya śārṅgiṇaḥ /
analyzed: mama ca api priyam viṣṇoḥ devadevasya śārṅgiṇaḥ
translated: And it is also dear to me, O Vishnu, the Sharnga-wielding God of gods,

original: mānuṣo vaidikācāraṃ manasā 'pi na laṅghayet // iti
analyzed: mānuṣaḥ vaidika ācāram manasā pi na laṅghayet iti
translated: that a human being should not transgress the Vedic conduct even in his mind. (Padma Purana)

original: ataḥ anadhikāriṇā kṛtaṃ śāstrāsammatam iti tantroktaprakāreṇa kṛtam api tat nāpavargapradam /
analyzed: atas anadhikāriṇā kṛtam śāstra asammatam iti tantra ukta prakāreṇa kṛtam api tat na apavarga pradam
translated: Therefore, what is done by one not qualified is not approved by scripture, and even if done according to the methods stated in the Tantras, it does not grant liberation.

original: nanu / brāhmaṇaiḥ kṣatriyaiḥ vaiśyaiḥ śūdraiś ca kṛtalakṣaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: nanu brāhmaṇaiḥ kṣatriyaiḥ vaiśyaiḥ śūdraiḥ ca kṛta lakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: By Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras who have the characteristics,

original: arcanīyaś ca sevyaś ca pūjanīyaś ca mādhavaḥ /
analyzed: arcanīyaḥ ca sevyaḥ ca pūjanīyaḥ ca mādhavaḥ
translated: Madhava is to be worshipped, served, and revered. (Padma Purana)

original: sāttvataṃ vidhim āsthāya gītaḥ saṅgarṣaṇena yaḥ //
analyzed: sāttvatam vidhim āsthāya gītaḥ saṅgarṣaṇena yaḥ
translated: which was sung by Sangarṣaṇa, following the Sāttvata method.

original: tantrānusāripūjāyāḥ apavargapradatvābhāvaḥ🔽iti śūdrādīnām api pāñcarātroktamārgeṇārcane adhikāre siddhe kathaṃ tāntrikoktaprakāreṇārcanaṃ kurvataḥ brāhmaṇādeḥ anadhikāriṇaḥ
analyzed: iti śūdra ādīnām api pāñcarātra ukta mārgeṇa arcane adhikāre siddhe katham tāntrika ukta prakāreṇa arcanam kurvataḥ brāhmaṇa ādeḥ anadhikāriṇaḥ
translated: The absence of the bestowal of liberation from the worship that follows the Tantra

original: tat apavargapradaṃ na bhavatīty ucyata iti ced ucyate /
analyzed: tat apavarga pradam na bhavati iti ucyate iti ced ucyate
translated: Thus, even for Śūdras and others, it is established that they are entitled to worship according to the Pāñcarātra path. How can it be said that the worship performed by a Brāhmaṇa and others who are not entitled to perform the worship described in the Tantra does not bestow liberation? If this is said, it is replied:

original: caturvidhatantreṣu ekatra dīkṣitasya tantrāntare 'nadhikāraḥ
analyzed: caturvidha tantreṣu ekatra dīkṣitasya tantra antare na adhikāraḥ
translated: One who is initiated in one of the four types of Tantra is not entitled to another Tantra.

original: prathamaṃ mantrasiddhāntaṃ dvitīyañ cāgamāhvayam /
translated: The first is the Mīmāṃsā conclusion, the second is called Āgama,

original: PādmaS caryāpāda /
